Reviews.Title: “Clean and new.”
Reviews.Author: Venessa H
Reviews.Content: We were greeted on arrival by welcoming staff who immediately made us feel at home. They were always helpful and professional. The room was spacious with a lovely bathroom and an amazing view of the city. In a fantastic location, we were able to walk to shops, restaurants and parks easily. Definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect first visit to Canada”
Reviews.Author: Tucsonteresa
Reviews.Content: I booked the Coast Coal Harbour from a list of places recommended from my convention info. It was expensive, but I enjoyed my stay so much that I don't really care. The staff was friendly right from the beginning at check-in. My room, in a corner, had fantastic views of the Inlet and the city. It was fun just to sit in the window area and watch the seagulls! I enjoyed eating in the restaurant, Preston's. The staff were easy going and friendly. The meal was quite good. This hotel is only a short walk to the Convention Center and Canada Place. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great packages”
Reviews.Author: Nicole M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and way more then I had imagined. I had purchased the girls night inn package which is $180 for two girls and $25 for each additional girl. You get pajamas from la vie en rose any appitizer, alcoholic beverage and breakfast the next morning. You can even get breakfast deluvered to you room for just $3. Prices for the room go up in the summer but I think its still worth it. We had a great time together and are views were amazing on the 16th floor. You have to check this place out if your staying in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Very funky new hotel”
Reviews.Author: artsluts
Reviews.Content: If you are in Vancouver for a conference at the Vancouver Convention Centre, do yourself a favour, don't book at the conference hotels directly opposite but save some money and get some exercise by walking 5 minutes to stay at this hotel. It's new and funky with excellent staff and comfortable, good-sized rooms. The restaurant on the second floor serves a good variety of West Coast dinners, and their breakfasts are reasonably priced. It's also just a short walk from West Georgia Street, and of course it is also very close to the bike trail along the waterfront if you fancy a run or walk up to Stanley Park. If possible, get a room overlooking West Hastings Street - with any luck you'll be able to see the harbour and the North Shore mountains between the buildings opposite. Nice to see the emphasis on saving the environment at this hotel - a compost box in the room as well as a recycling box, and refillable soap dispensers instead of all those little bottles of shampoo in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “great stay Mike G.”
Reviews.Author: Michael G
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel as the staff was friendly and knowledgeable. the location was excellent as well. I did pay extra for an upgraded room which gave us spectacular views looking north and onto the harbour. The hotel is conveneintly located in close proximity to Stanly Park, Gas Lamp District, China Town and skiing. The upgraded room was larger and clean. The only complaint if I had one was that the shower stall was a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: CycleFan
Reviews.Content: Stayed last summer as a family of 4 and found the hotel to be in an ideal location for getting out and about. Minutes walk from Stanley Park, Harbour, Robson Street, and Gas Town. And the beaches on the west side are easily reachable on foot within 20 or so minutes. Although ineraction with staff was limited to check in and check out both times we found them friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and simply decorated in a modern fashion. Only reason we didn't give it 5 stars was the aircon as it only had two modes of operation - "off and silent" or "ON & LOUD!!!!". Still, being jetlagged at the start of our Canadian holiday it didn't affect us too much. Would be happy to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room”
Reviews.Author: Catharine J
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were FANTASTIC! Extremely small room, stayed with my husband and two kids. Only double beds, no table to eat at for the room service, no fridge. And parking was to be paid upon check out. This I was not aware of, I thought it would have been included in the hotel cost. I too booked through hotwire.com and got a good price, but was not impressed with the cost of parking, $33 per night. Coming from a small town to the BIG city, it was a shock. Overall very clean, Preston's was a great place to eat as well. Not a hotel for more than two guests.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome.”
Reviews.Author: Janice W
Reviews.Content: Booked this because of trip advisor and the great reviews. Was not disappointed at all. I was there with my daughter for a weekend and we were more than taken care of. Rooms were sleek and most importantly clean as well as the rest of the hotel including the restaurant. We felt very safe and the staff was incredibly helpful and attentive.We didn't use the exercise room but should have, it looked clean, with good equipment. We walked everywhere from here, close to the Seawall and Stanley Park and some incredible views!

Reviews.Title: “All good, very happy with this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Happywalkabout
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel easily from the airport via Skytrain/local line to Burrard then a short walk. We decided to stop over in Vancouver before heading to Whistler just to catch our breathe and recover after a very long travel time involving a couple of flights. Ended up really enjoying our stay. Clean room, comfortable bed, good shower and lovely staff. We got a great rate online and it wasn't too much more to upgrade to a King room with a view at check-in. We usually like a small refrigerator in our room, but we were easily able to get ice and everything else was so good we really didn't mind not having one.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get better than this!”
Reviews.Author: 5Wearytraveller3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. The staff, from the doorman to the checkout agent, are patient and very oriented to providing exceptional service and making a positive impression. Eager to please, professional and efficient, they create an oasis of true service in an industry that often fails to meet expectations. On arrival, the doorman was quick to open the cab door and welcome us to the hotel. He took charge of removing our belongings from the trunk and had sufficient time to even open my door before I could complete payment of the cab fare. He waited patiently until I was ready to exit the cab and, noting that we had limited luggage, offered assistance with the bags instead of assuming complete control of them. Next, my check-in went quickly and flawlessly. The agent met me with a welcoming smile as I approached her and appeared to be genuinely pleased that she could settle me into the hotel and answer any questions I might have. I asked how I might arrange a wake-up call and she quickly took it upon herself to ensure that I need not do anything else. Many other 4 star hotels often provide you with procedures to obtain a wake-up call from your room instead. The lobby is well-maintained, spacious, and tastefully decorated in warm tones. The elevators are roomy and very efficient. Before you even realise it, the door opens and you're on your floor. My room was a corner room on the 12th? floor. There was more than enough room (for two) to get comfortable in. Nothing was out of place in the room and there was no evidence that someone had previously stayed here. It was pristine and the air was fresh. The room also had all of the amenities that a traveller might need; and some that are not always found in 4-star accomodation. I chose one of the double beds in the room for the night and found it just a tad firm to my liking. It didn't occur to me to play Goldilocks and try the other bed. I wouldn't be surprised if the other was less firm, though I'm speculating based on overall impressions. My colleague called me from her room to meet her as we'd decided to have dinner at Prestons, the hotel's restaurant. On arrival at Prestons, more smiling, friendly faces to greet you and settle you into your table without delay. Prestons looks to be an upscale restaurant. Though well lit, the ambience is welcoming and likely more suitable to a business dinner than a quiet/romantic dinner. That said, I would have no hesitation to celebrate a romantic dinner with my wife. The restaurant is large enough that there are likely quiet corners available. The service was professional, yet warm. Alisha (forgive the spelling if its wrong) eased my normal reservations about any unfamiliar restaurant immediately. She devoted herself to helping me though my selections of unfamiliar ales and wines, appetizers, mains, and desserts. There was a lot of choice in both appetizers and mains, and ultimately, though regretfully, I could only manage one of each. I was already cursing my next day early evening departure which would deny me the opportunity to sample other delights on the menu. Alisha continued to appear throughout the evening at opportune times, to ensure that the evening would be memorable for not only the quality of the food, but the generosity of her service. The next morning, I opted for the buffet breakfast instead of the, a la carte. There was ample choice of freshly-prepared American breakfast items (the stick to you stomach fare) and the normal continental items such as croissants, breads, cereals and yogurts. I sampled a little of most items including one smallish almond croissant which was the highlight of breakfast. It was reminiscent of some of the better croissants I've tasted in France. I'm hopeful that I won't be waiting another 33 years until my next visit to Vancouver as I'd like to revisit this establishment. I heartily recommend this hotel and its restaurant. From my experience, the staff's DNA doesn't permit them to disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ThiesHH
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in the Coast Coal Harbour hotel in Vancouver and I have to say, this is a really beautiful hotel. I had a nice room on the 19th floor with a view on the marina. Huge glass fronts. The rooms are very spacious and nice chosen style of furniture. should you ever travel to Vancouver, I can only recommend this hotel. The only minus point was the restaurant. I ordered breakfast on the room. And she forgot the half and brought tea instead of coffee... that was a big minus point. Quality of Dinner there was bad as well. But that doesn't really matter, as in the surrounding are plenty of nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in excellent downtown location”
Reviews.Author: OldFart06
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance of Stanley Park, the Harbour, downtown shopping, great coffee shops, the West End and Robson Street. In other words, there is a lot to do near this hotel that does not require a car. I was here for business and took the Skytrain from the airport and it was a less than 10 minute walk from the terminus to the hotel. Reception checking in was efficient and friendly. The next morning, the front desk was busy so the hotel manager came along and looked after me when he saw a bit of a wait. The room was very comfortable. In the room, the wireless internet was reasonably good although a bit slow with streaming (not much of a complaint) I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a nice part of town. Handy to Stanley park and most attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Sosuma
Reviews.Content: This is a large, modern hotel with comfortable rooms and good views. You can't really beat the location and it's a good hotel for business and leisure travel. Beds are comfortable and the room features are up to date. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Business”
Reviews.Author: Brian_Mairs
Reviews.Content: The Coast Coal Harbour is my home away from home when I am in Downtown Vancouver. The rooms are spacious, free WiFi, a business centre to print documents as required and a great restaurant for all three meals. Conference facilities are excellent and the staff at all levels are friendly, courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “updated fixtures”
Reviews.Author: mariya330
Reviews.Content: the hotel is newer and the rooms are abit larger than Marriot Pinnacle. the room lacks a refrigerator but there's a ice machine on the floor. free wifi is available in the rooms. large bottles of shampoos/bodywashes/lotions. the valet parking is also a little cheaper than Marriot. there's a 7-11 store right behind the hotel and a grocery store less than a block away. it's a good place to stay in Vancouver,BC.

Reviews.Title: “Modern clean hotel with friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: IanBurk
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice and will definitely be back again. It is gorgeous place to be, and the staff are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Value”
Reviews.Author: starabula
Reviews.Content: The hotel comes with plenty of positives. First, service was great. Starting from check-in, to room service, restaurant, event staff staff, and finally check-out. The location was amazing. Near the water, Stanley Park, Robson and Granville Street! Modern decor, clean, safe, and quiet. Treated us, young couple, with respect and appreciation. It's a great choice if you are looking for a hotel in downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay”
Reviews.Author: DCGuy1414
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate here on hotwire, and couldnt have asked for a better place to end up. Everything about this hotel was clean, simple, and high quality. The staff, from the valet to the front desk, were beyond friendly, and extremely professional. I liked the location, a short walk to the beautiful views along the sea wall, or to the busier parts of town for shopping, bars, and restaurants. I would absolutely stay here again on my next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at Coast Coal harbour Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Colette R
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the level of service and kindness of all the staff, very comfortable room, Also, as we were there for a conference we spent most of our time in the hotel and felt very well cared for during our stay. I would go back to this hotel again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer experience”
Reviews.Author: 79traveller79
Reviews.Content: Hotel prefers elite clients, went against their word in person and via email on holding a venue for 3 weeks without a deposit. "I have penciled you in for Sept 29th, I can keep this tentative hold for 3 weeks before we'd need to commit with a deposit and contract." Denied us the right to give first right of refusal, in less than 3 weeks after communicated we were ready to put a deposit. told us this "It's a very unusual circumstance to have a conference book so quickly. Unfortunately because this is a longstanding customer of the hotel my hands are tied." No compensation or help for other venue...Terrible customer service...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jono5565
Reviews.Content: Nice new hotel, great location. Nice warm outdoor heated pool. Only thing my wife and I didn't like was the mandatory valet parking for $33 per day. Other then that our stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RadTimes
Reviews.Content: Coast Coal Harbor Hotel is nice new hotel. Clean, quiet rooms with very comfortable beds. Nothing extraordinary just a simple modern layout with some pretty nice views out of the (floor to ceiling) windows on the top floors where I stayed. The staff are very helpful and professional. The service at the restaurant and bar on the premises are great as well. Valet Parking was expensive but the convenience was worth it. The location is the greatest. You're right on the waterfront and close to skytrain so you can get just about anywhere pretty quickly. I don't spend much time in hotel rooms when traveling, especially in a beautiful city like Vancouver, so no fridge was no big deal. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's an OK hotel but certainly not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: donald s
Reviews.Content: Clean and quiet rooms but relatively modest in finishing and smallish. Furniture was older and chipped, TV and rooms were small, no fridge, ice machine/pop is behind locked door. View is of office workers. At best this is 3.5 for Vancouver. Valet parking was $38/night which seemed steep given all day parking was $25 next door.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Megan W
Reviews.Content: My 11 month old son and I had a great time staying at the Coast Coal Harbour Hotel. The room was immaculate and he could crawl around on the floor without me worrying. The room layout was very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and courteous and made us feel welcome. The rooms were very sound proof as well. Thank you for a great visit to Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Close to convention centre”
Reviews.Author: Hugh K
Reviews.Content: Just steps from Vancouver's Playhouse Wine Festival made this hotel a natural choice. Clean modern lines outside and in with very European esthetic. No fussy details but neither empty cold nor harsh/edgy feel. Guest room was functional with nice play of cool and warm colour elements. Hotel is only two years old I believe, so still fresh and unworn. If you are a Coast member I would recommend. Sadly, we are not choosing Coast these days following and experience with their rewards program administrator. Our selection this time was to blowout last points as final hurrah. Front desk staff were so helpful in providing transit and restaurant directions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Retyred
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a block away from the seawall walk to Stanley Park, the convention center and the Olympic torch. Urban fare is across the street for fast food or groceries. Starbucks half a block away and Prestons restaurant is in the building. The staff are very friendly and welcoming, more than any hotel I can recall. I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Like visiting good friends.”
Reviews.Author: CaptSamme
Reviews.Content: The staff were all very friendly in a genuine way without being over the top or like trained robots. Felt valued as a person not just a credit card number. :-)

Reviews.Title: “business visitor for 2 days”
Reviews.Author: MaryTeresia
Reviews.Content: The Vancouver Coast Harbour Hotel met all my needs. This is the second year I've used them for an annual convention. I stayed Feb 23 and 24, with late checkout granted effortlessy on Friday the 24th. The hotel held my luggage till 10 PM and called me a cab instantly. As a single woman traveler, I appreciated the good service and safe feeling. I had no issues with eating alone in Preston's, and enjoyed the food. The hotel also supplies good toiletries. Complimentary Internet worked just fine for me because I worked at odd hours (jetlag) so connection and speed wasn't an issue. I didn't need to upgrade. What this hotel doesn't have is pizzazz. By this I mean it's modern, efficient, comfortable, and bland. Old fashioned ambiance and great style can be found elsewhere. But absolutely everything wroked fine here, and it was remarkably good value for my business travel needs.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good but a Few Drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: jdr27
Reviews.Content: Given the lofty TA ratings, I guess I expected a bit more but overall was pleased with my stay. The hotel is modern, clean and upbeat and has a very nice staff which goes out of their way to help out. Rooms are comfortable, spacious and clean as well but felt there was an inordinate amount of noise emanating from both the street (traffic and poor insulation) and the hallways (heard doors slamming all night), which would lead me to be cautious in my review. Also a bit surprised there was no minibar in the room. I also hate the $30 upgrade to a king bed policy, which makes you feel as though you are being nickel and dimed. Good, but not great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very nice people”
Reviews.Author: dybdahl
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend in Vancouver, B.C. I'm tired from the rainy drive home and the ridiculous wait at the border. (Note to US Customs: Add staff and open more than three lanes on the last day of a three-day weekend in the U.S.) But I had to stop and write a note about the Coast Coal Harbour Hotel where I stayed four nights. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. It's a newer property and well appointed, including big bathrooms and a very comfortable mattress. It's close to the convention center and to shopping. Lots of interesting eateries around. But the people are what make this a top-notch place to be. Everyone, from the parking valet to the front desk to the woman who cleaned my room, was friendly, helpful, hospitable. Sure, they are supposed to be all those things, but this group just takes it up a notch. There was a mixup in the type of room I needed. No big deal, but they worked to find another room that would work. The next day someone from the staff saw me in the restaurant and my beverages were on the house to make up for the mistake. I needed a refrigerator for some medication, and they delivered one within minutes. I will stay here on my next trip to Vancouver. You should too.

Reviews.Title: “my 6 day stay”
Reviews.Author: jackdose
Reviews.Content: the hotel is pretty much brand new like,it look's very clean in the check-in area and the room's are quite clean too,bath room's look good,the tub could be a little bigger if you like to take a nice Relaxing Soak,shower has good water pressure with different setting's on the shower-head,bodywash/hand soap & hair shampoo is supplied,but it smell's cheap and funny,like noxzema,so Bring your Own,Ear tip's and facial Cleaning pad's are in a jar in the bathroom also,You Are in walking distance of the Huge shopping area of Robson Street with some High End store's and Places to Eat or Drink!...Jugo juice is located on this street too,Yumm,This hotel also has a Panago Pizza place right by it,Next to 24 hour 7/11...so in-case you get late night munchies's,you cannot say you'll starve here...it also take's about a 16 minute walk to get to the skytrain's to get to metrotown mall since you'll see every store on Robson in about a day or 2 & Bought everything already...I Just wish the internet could be a little faster,downloading was capped at 130kb a second and it look sweet forever to watch youtube video's on the laptop or even trying to video skype with family member's. ,Most of the time when you go to hotel's it is 1 megabyte a second (10x then what i was downloading here) & everything is blazing fast with no waiting, they do have "premium" wi-fi connection,But that sound's like a money making scam since their bandwidth-capping the "free" internet..You think a hotel this modern wouldn't do this & the price you paid already,Mehh.....oh yeah and the staff here is a very nice multicultural group which i Like because it Reflex's Vancouver as it's Self,very helpful too...Food at the restaurant is quite good,Really fashionable place to eat at,had breakfast & it was really good!....That's about it,for Now til next time!

Reviews.Title: “Girls Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Super8Langley
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for the weekend for a girls getaway. The rate was amazing considering the Coast Hotel is in a prime location. The staff were all great, and very helpful. The room had a floor to ceiling windows making for a nice view of the city at night. Will without a doubt stay here again next time I come to the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “All I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: Cecilie Z
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a fresh, clean, comfortable hotel in downtown Vancouver, I can definitely recommend this place. It's not particularly spectacular, but it had everything I was looking for (good location, quiet, nice room with a great washroom/shower and very helpful staff) and at a good price. Wouldn't mind staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: BaradaKitty
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend with my pre-teen daughter. We signed up for an Art in the City package which was very good value, considering it included breakfast, valet parking and passes to the Art Gallery. Our room was very comfortable. We had a peek-a-boo view of the harbour and could see planes landing but mostly wanted to keep the drapes closed as we could also see the people in the office buildings across the street. The room was very quiet and beds very comfortable. There was a lovely large tub and great shower. It would have been nice to have a small refrigerator but that's about all I would want added to the room. Food at the restaurant was excellent and we also went to the nail spa, which was very conveniently located in the same building. As far as location went, we could walk downtown or to other shopping and entertainment usually within 15 minutes, which was perfect. The only glitch with our stay was that there was confusion regarding the Art Gallery passes and gift shop discount. The front desk staff were great in trying to figure it out and the only delay had to do with the manager deciding how to handle the situation. I did have to ask about it rather than having somebody get back to me, but in the end, they provided adequate compensation and I left happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great experience.”
Reviews.Author: Mariborsalas
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night as i had business to do right across the street. Beautiful hotel with great amenities. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Location is centered as well as quite. Coffees and shops are close-by. Working in the industry myself, i would recommend this hotel to anyone. Prices are correct.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for an upscale stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tfne
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff that go out of their way to please and attend to guests. Incredibly comfortable beds and clean relaxing room. Location is slightly away from bars and nightlfe but perfect for the business professional. Only complaint would be the $37/night valet parking!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent choice, nice rooms (with iPod/iPhone docking !)”
Reviews.Author: elodTlv
Reviews.Content: Likes: - room size and amenities (it even has a small iPod/iPhone docking station) - great location, not far from Gastown and right near the harbour - decent WiFi signal throughout the hotel - swimming pool and gym - valet parking Ok, but can improve: - it's somewhat annoying that you need to re-login to the WiFi after some time - breakfast was definitely decent, but I like buffet style better - it would have been nice if it was possible to earn miles on airlines other than Air Canada

Reviews.Title: “Top rate hotel”
Reviews.Author: pendergirl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels over my career and personal life and have to say, I would rate this as my number one stay. It was affordable, clean, friendly staff, great room, awe inspiring view and I felt there was a surprise round every corner regarding decor. I was so disappointed that it was a business trip, I arrived late due to travelling and had to attend training all day, so disappointed I could not enjoy the room and facilities more. I came home and raved about it to my husband and we are hoping to visit again soon in the next few weeks, and taking our dog. I was lucky that I had a friend who was local and could show me round the area, great location and surprisingly quiet. Only issue I did have is that the heating system was fairly noisey and there was a strange loud noise early in the morning that appeared to be coming out of the room vents. Overall experience, I would rate more than five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DiscoverAndEnjoy
Reviews.Content: Well situated, great rooms, friendly staff would recommend this hotel for any business traveller or family that wants to be in the core of the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Affordable Vancouver Hotel”
Reviews.Author: appeal2
Reviews.Content: Service couldn't have been more friendly. Prestons restaurant food was a real pleasant surprise. Very comfortable room. All around great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Four Nigth Stay”
Reviews.Author: phildogg102
Reviews.Content: Reason for staying: Tradeshow in Coal Harbour Pros: Location: Minutes from Robson, Coal Harbour, Convention Centre and Stanley Park. The trade show I was attending was located at the Bayshore (1km away). We walked over every morning along the water, amazing views. Great way to start and end the day. Staff: Everyone was helpful and courteous. Valet and doormen were on the ball and can recommend restaurants and bars. Rooms: Ample size with floor to ceiling windows. Decor is bright and modern. Very eco friendly for a hotel. Waste separation, low volume flush toilet and master switch to kill power when occupying the room. Shower water pressure is still awesome! It was quiet and comfortable. WiFi worked well. Ensure you keep window coverings closed, unless you want office buildings and condos looking in on you. Restaurant: Prestons: Went here to eat and have drinks, excellent service. Food was great, make sure to try the seafood chowder. business casual type atmosphere. Cons: I usually have some cons, but I can't seem to come up with any. Overall, the price was excellent ($143 a night) and the hotel was even better!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4 night stay”
Reviews.Author: noleyne m
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 nights at the Coast Coal Harbour from 26/12/11 to 30/12/11 and it was just lovely. This hotel was everything it said on the internet. The staff were friendly and very welcoming. Jeremy made us feel very special. Thank you. We loved the location, easy walking distance to everything and the view was amazing. Great value. A mini fridge may have been useful BUT ice did the job and a refrig could be wasted on most guests. Overall it is probably not a necessity. Excellent, we will be back if we are fortunate enough to be in Vancouver again and we do plan to do so. Noleyne & John - Pine Mountain, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel-watch the parking”
Reviews.Author: Mac9
Reviews.Content: Well located in the heart of downtown vancouver business district. Well represented for it's 4 star rating. They offer free wireless internet, pool, fitness center, and a business center. Received a coupon for a complimentary appetizer at check in for their 2nd floor restaurant. The only issue was the cost of daily parking-$38. I am advised these high costs are throughout downtown vancouver due to the extremely high taxes from the city. It appears the city of vancouver would like you your business, but your auto is not welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalistic Elegance”
Reviews.Author: UtahPooch
Reviews.Content: A clean, modern, quiet alternative to the mega chain hotels that surround it. This is the second time I have stayed and the staff is always polite and accommodating. It is just a short walk to everything and Prestons, the on-site restaurant, is a worthy destination on its own. Cindy at the front desk was amazing in combining two back to back reservations so I would not have to check out and back-in half way through a 7 day stay. The only things that could be changed are more storage space (i.e. drawers) and a mini-fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but load up on ice for the bucket.”
Reviews.Author: Skibug_10
Reviews.Content: We found the location to be perfect, close to the Coal Harbour walkway and just blocks away from West Georgia and Robson Street. Hotel is close to shopping and a variety of eating establishments are within walking distance. Staff were top notch, very helpful, friendly and cheerful.Fitness studio was perfect with a variety of equipment to choose from. Room was comfortable and bright. The only minor downside was it had no mini fridge so the ice bucket is all you had to keep things cool. FYI – if you have a car, it is valet parking only – 33 bucks and change to park for a day.

Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Content: Clean, fresh & modern without being stuffy! I've stayed at many high end hotels in Vancouver but it's the staff that keeps me coming back! From jeremy & sharon at the front desk to Ron the bellman! It's great when people work so hard to make you feel so special. It's the simple things such people knowing your name! I love it!

Reviews.Title: “Things couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: by-boat
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for a quick overnight visit at the Coast. Things couldn't have been better! This hotel is attractive, clean, conveniently located and really good value for money. The staff were genuinely friendly and provided great service. The restaurant was a pleasure. We had planned to eat out but, the complementary appetizer coupon we were given at check-in enticed us into Preston's Restaurant for a look. Once we were settled in with more friendly staff and a very nice looking menu in front of us we were there for the evening! I highly recommend the Coast Coal Harbour and look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value great location a must stay!”
Reviews.Author: kiwisolargal
Reviews.Content: Arrived Christmas Day to meet the very friendly Reception staff, rooms clean, spacious and hotel has a good feeling about it. Great location easy walk to Stanley Park, Canada Place and downtown. Hotel spa/hot tub and warm pool were lovely after busy days sightseeing. Gym facilities and showers were all good too. Bathrooms good size with lovely soaps, shampoo & conditioner etc. Free wifi was wonderful for the teenagers! Restaurant looked good although we didn't get to use it we did however enjoy some lovely room service meals. Appreciated the inter connecting rooms. Has a valet service for cars. Booked through Hotwire secret Santa I called it where you don't know Hotel name until you purchase worked well for us. There is the option to choose hotel through Hotwire too either worked brillantly for our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! Only positive”
Reviews.Author: Hugoban
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and efficient! The hotel was in pristine condition as was my room. Free room wi-fi internet (which should be a no-brainer these days). The room felt brand new. Clean and set-up perfectly for working and relaxing. The iPhone compatible alarm clock (iHome) was an added bonus! Coffee and tea in the room - again from a business perspective is such a helpful value-add.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Bassman68
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay and had our cat with us due to home renovations.  With that said, upon arrival we were welcomed by the valet & door man, and Claire & David at the front desk were very helpful and supportive with our pet.  The hotel is well located for a nice walk which we enjoyed to our dinner location, then we came back to an beverage & appetizer in Preston's, great environment:)...breakfast the next morning was great also.   Next stay we will pack to enjoy the amenities of the gym, pool and jacuzzi.  My wife was impressed with the eco-ness of our hotel, but how clean and welcoming the guest room and hotel decor is...again great experience and would not hesitate to suggest to anyone...staff are great and VERY friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - first choice”
Reviews.Author: Kerry H
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the top floor, with stunning views of the city! Although you could hear the lift it didn't bother us - the fantastic room and the breath taking view of the city was worth it. The gym is well kitted out, and the outside swimming pool is small but a lovely addition: spent most nights in there! The breakfast was delicious but expensive, however you must expect that in Vancouver. Good location too - only 15 minutes from Stanley Park and a short walk away from the coastline. Overall, we would recommend this hotel as our first choice to stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “~ Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BuriedTreasure
Reviews.Content: ~ My wife and I have stayed here a few times and love it. Friendly staff and great location in downtown Vancouver. We booked through Hotwire and usually are able to get a room for $80.

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: wck112
Reviews.Content: very modern and clean hotel. love the color and decor in the room. would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Cocodela
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for three night last month. It's in a great location, and the price is right but it really ends up being a basic hotel. If budget is the question then I can't complain about this hotel , but when you're staying any length of time the absence of a mini bar or fridge is really noticeable. The linens are nice, the beds are comfy (but small) and the bathrooms are very clean and modern. Its a quiet location and far enough from Georgia that you don't get too much street noise. The outdoor pool is heated and warm enough to swim laps even in December and the hot tub was very well kept. The only thing that I found odd was after the first day housekeeping didn't arrive until 5pm, which seemed really odd to me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value with few hitches”
Reviews.Author: Gregory D
Reviews.Content: Previous ratings of this hotel are on the mark: extremely clean, minimalistic but tasteful decor, friendly staff, etc. We enjoyed the pool/hot tub and made good use of the exercise room. The location is excellent, and there were no issues with noise. My only major concern was that at check in, a $500 hold was placed on my account. As I used a debit card, this means they took $500 out of my checking. It's back in my account, so that's not an issue, but I wish I was informed of the amount of the hold at check in, rather than be surprised while checking my account on the (thankfully) free internet. Otherwise, this is an EASY hotel to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Goodbye Marriott”
Reviews.Author: DKSG123
Reviews.Content: During our vacation in Vancouver we stayed at Marriott just down the street, which is my favourite hotel. We eventually had to move to Coast Coal Harbour since there weren't any rooms available. The room we got was brand new, modern, and perfectly clean. I loved the amazing view the large windows revealed, and the location was great. Overall i found the Coast Coal Harbour Hotel to be much better value than the Marriott Hotel we stayed in before - a tough realization being the Marriott fan that i am. I will be staying here in the future

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dlatham
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at a Coast Hotel property before. The service was top notch. The hotel is in the downtown area a block away from the Harbor and close to pretty much most people would want to see. The price was good. I can not say enough good things about the room, 90% glass only the bathroom did not have a view. I really liked this hotel and will stay at a Coast Hotel again. I can not say anything bad about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and fresh looking hotel for a great price.”
Reviews.Author: drifting_nomad
Reviews.Content: I used the websavers promotion through the hotel website starting at $99 - comfort room for 2. The hotel honoured our request for a corner room on the 10 floor or higher with a view of the harbour. We had a great view of the area with our room being on the 17th floor over parts of stanley park, the mountains on the north shore, the seaplanes on the harbour and other residential buildings. I would recommend staying in rooms than end with 13, 14, or 15. But I believe the rooms ending with 14 may have the best view of the harbour. Comforts rooms are a modest size but the style is very appealing and everything fits well. Only drawback were there were no slippers for the cold bathroom floor or toothbrushes. There is a bath tub and shower and the gym is well equipped. Staff are very hospitable and efficient. We had some noise outside our room and they were quick to sort that out. Also had a corporate Christmas dinner there and the service was exceptional and all the hors d'oeuvres and entrées were just superb compliments of the hotel restaurant 'Prestons'. A great place to hold a corporate event or banquet.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel with Good location”
Reviews.Author: PenderBender
Reviews.Content: I've been staying here off and on all year while doing fill in work after retiring a couple of years ago. I find it good value for the money and the service is excellent. My preferences are outlined in the Coast Hotel Rewards system and I always get a nice room, usually with a great view of the water, north shore mountains and Stanley Park. It is really nice to get up in the morning during summer and see the cruise ships arriving. This hotel is well situated for easy access to the rest of downtown and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: RedSavage
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the heart of downdown Vancouver. The location is walking distance to Gastown and a short drive to Stanley Park. Ferry and public transportation hubs are close by. The service was great. Everyone I dealt with was super nice and very helpful, including the onsite restaurant. One morning I came down for breakfast and the restaurant wasn't opening in time for me and a nice hotel employee pointed me down the street to a place that was open. My room was very nice. Free wi-fi, iPod doc, coffee pot and great toiletries were included. I had a corner room and could just see a water view! The beds were comfortable and the room was nicely decorated and very clean. All in all it was a very good experience

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hidden treasure!”
Reviews.Author: bmsullivans
Reviews.Content: As someone had mentioned in a previous review, i really don't want to say much as this hotel is a perfect little treasure. The rooms are nice and clean. The staff was great. Service - no complaints there!!The location you can't beat. Its super close to all the fine shopping and dining. Great JOB Coast Coal! You will definitely see us again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: sazzyb8
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Maybe it was having travelled on Via rail for 4 days but this place was luxurious and comfortable. To me, it felt like a spa resort. Staff are amazing! We were trying to get an apartment here and they all went out of their way to help us. Rooms are large, clean and well furnished. Complimentary toiletries were lovely and replenished daily. Beds were comfy and clean. Internet was excellent and quick. I can't fault this place, we loved it and would definitely return. It was on the pricey side but for a treat it is well worth the money. Great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location and friendly knowledgeable staff”
Reviews.Author: MLR60
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a premium room with lots of space for two of us to share The room was clean, quiet and well appointed. Love the opening windows! Great location for the Convention Centre, walking and shopping! The front desk staff were excellent, making sure I made the most of my Coast Reward points. The food in the restaurant was surprisingly good - breakfast, late night dinner and appies. Nice touch on the appies coupon. Everyone seemed to go out of their way to make sure we had want a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Coast Coal Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Louise A
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, comfortable, and beautiful rooms = I would stay there again when I am back in Vancouver. Close to the Canada Line (Sky Train) which I took from the airport. Wonderful location near shopping and business. Great special rates. Very easy, no stress Vancouver trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cml80_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was fairly small but the great location (right in the downtown area) made it worthwhile. Bed was amazing! Bit disappointed there was no fridge in the room? Free use of computers / internet and free printing was also a plus. Staff were lovely. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: gol1ca
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Hotwire and wow, were we surprised. Stayed for Grey Cup 2011 and as this hotel is so well located in the downtown, we could walk everywhere! 1 block from the Convention Center and Canada Place. 5 min walk to Robson street where there are shops and restaurants abound! We walked to the big game in under 25 min. Rooms are a nice size and very very modern. Did not hear anyone else on the floor (8th). Security in elevator with only key access to floors. Staff was excellent! I am almost afraid to write this review as it may lead to more and more travellers to use this hotel. I would recommend to anyone going to Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: JLA10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coast Coal Harbour for Grey Cup weekend, November 25-28, 2011. The hotel is newer (opened 2 weeks before the 2010 Winter Olympics) and is comfortably modern. Nice sized rooms, small floors, low noise (on the 15th floor), and good downtown location on West Hastings Street, a block from the waterfront and Convention Centre. Preston's, the hotel's restaurant, is also quite good. There is a 7-11 just behind the hotel for quick purchases and a couple of good coffee shops (including several Starbucks) in the surrounding blocks. We enjoyed our stay as the hotel was clean and quiet but I have to remark that the fantastic service made this one of my favourite stays. All of the staff was incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Good location 3 Blocks to Canada Place”
Reviews.Author: appywanderers
Reviews.Content: Accessible by Canada Line from Airport 4 level walking blocks from the last stop Seabus Waterfront Station. Here is a tip, go to the 7-11 store located on the lower level of YVR domestic arrival and buy a book of 10 transit pass 2 zone $31.50 otherwise will cost $8.75 per person. After 6 and weekends can use 1 zone pass which is $21 for book of 10. Taxi from airport about $34. The hotel is located 1 block from the Coal Harbour waterfront walk. Construction of hotel was completed just prior to winter Olympics so is very new and extremely clean. It has a pool and excercise area. Preston's is an upscale eat and wine bar located on the Pender St entrance. The market located 1/2 block NW on Bute has good pre cooked home style, they serve buffet at very good prices with Lamb Shanks, Butter chicken, Panini etc winr and beer open till mid evening. They also have fresh fruit bread and good selection of cheeses in the adjacent market. Valet parking $25 + per day. Vancouver has expensive street meter parking 7 days a week until 9pm. As the hotel is located on the last or most west block of Hastings St minimal traffic and street noise. I found the elevator (3) mounted on the top floor are very noisy so requested no rooms on top floor or above the 12th floor. I do think the doors need to be better sound proofed. Easy to here house keeping knocking on other doors on floor and identifying it is "house Keeping". Noisy fans and air conditioning in rooms. Better leave fan on all time or not at all as does generate louder noise on start up which is frequent depending on the ac setting.

Reviews.Title: “Updated Decor, Clean But Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Bergs655
Reviews.Content: Booked two nights via Hotwire and received about a 35% savings! Our room was nice and updated; however the door joining to the next room and the hallways door were both lacking any sort of sound proofing. The first night we were kept up by out neighbours watching TV, and then in the morning we were woken buy them getting ready for the day. It’s not that they were not being loud; it was just the poor sound proofing between the doors. The second night and morning were a little more restful, as we did not have anyone next to us. The entrance door leading to the hallways was also lacking any sort of sound proofing, which was concerning for our own privacy. We could hear clear as day, the conversations of guests and staff outside our room. Both mornings, we were woken by staff knocking on doors and calling out “house keeping” as well as the opening and closing of a storage closet used by housekeeping. During our checkout, I was asked by the desk agent how our stay was and I informed him of the noise issues. Instead of apologizing, he informed us he does not receive this complaint very often and because we booked our stay on Hotwire, we didn’t have much choice in our hotel options. I told him we were happy with the hotel and service but just thought he should know about the issue. He didn’t seem too concerned. We had one room charge of $75 for two nights of car parking and when he entered the amount into the debit machine he only entered $14.04 (which was our room number), so I asked him jokingly, if the amount was correct and if he were giving us a deal because of our room issues…. He said “opps, no I’m not” I thought this was the perfect opportunity to make up for our two noisy night, but I guess not. Would I stay at this hotel again?..… Only if it were deeply discounted.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Owl_86
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Coast Coal Harbour for a few days in June, and was really pleased with the value for money and location - I am constantly amazed at the quality and value of Canadian hotels compared to those in Europe. The staff were friendly and courteous throughout our stay, ensuring we were provided with maps and helping us to arrange transport when we were ready to leave to make our way to the coach station for the next part of our trip. A minor complaint was that we were initially allocated a double room having booked a twin, but this was quickly fixed and whilst we were out for dinner on our first evening our things were moved into a different room - unfortunately we lost the wonderful harbour view of the first room and ended up in a room which overlooked the neighbouring office block. The hotel is in an ideal location for exploring downtown Vancouver, and we found we were able to walk to most places that we needed to go to. However, it's not far from the local underground station if you don't want to walk or are travelling a little further. All in all, I was very pleased with my short stay and would definitely return on a future visit to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “5-star service for 3 star prices.”
Reviews.Author: tripchick29
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid November for 2 nights and we very pleasantly surprised by the quality of the hotel. I believe it is listed at a 3.5 star hotel, but it is definitely closer to 4. I booked the room through Hotwire at the excellent price of $86/night. Apart from getting a room with 2 double beds ( it is Hotwire after all), you can't beat the price for the location. I agree with the majority of positive reviews here and would like to highlight the following: Pros *Downtown location, next to the Marriott Pinnacle and other similar hotels *Clean, bright rooms with iPod docking stations *free Wi Fi everywhere *large format soaps and lotions in the bathroom *Absolutely excellent service from check in to room service to guest services * pet friendly hotel/non smoking rooms Cons *located a bit further away from the entertainment district but well within easy walking distance *no bathrobes *in room coffee was really bad--actually un drinkable. The brand was very good, but I suspect there was a problem with the coffee maker, I.e. cleaners not rinsed out properly or similar. The same brand coffee delivered through room service was great. I would stay here again for sure. It's an excellent choice for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “This is the Place to Stay.”
Reviews.Author: John A
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel, close to everything. We stayed on the 19th floor, requested a view of the harbour and this was all granted. Prestons restaurant has a great breakfast and very decent value. My only minor complaint would be that the shower stall in our room was very tiny, and I am not a big person. But overall everything was terrific. As for the valet parking, I would suggest everyone books this hotel in a package, as this would then include the valet parking which alone is about $30 some per night. I will definately be back and will recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mpd51
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, easy to arrive by car. The staff are very helpful, the room spacious, beds very comfortable. All was clean and fresh. It was so easy to stay here, regrettable only for one night. I will return and plan to enjoy the amenitites the hotel has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Coast Coal Harbour Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Walter W
Reviews.Content: This is the Coast's boutique hotel located in the heart of Coal Harbour. It is a superb location and I understand it opened days before the Olympics. It is impeccably maintained and exceptionally clean.The best part of the hotel is the staff however. They are very professional and friendly as well. It is a pleasure to stay there and I look forward to returning. The restaurant Preston's is very good too but if you are staying at the Coast also cross the street and check out the Urban Fair deli. Excellent coffee, breakfasts, and inexpensive snacks and or meals. I love Coal Harbour and the Coast has a gem in this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: sullim4
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel through Hotwire at $80/night. The room itself was excellent, it was located on the 9th floor. We looked into an office building, but I expected that given that I was paying the deeply discounted Hotwire rate. The pool and hot tub operate 365 days a year, and it was fun to hang out in there on a Saturday night in the cold and rain! The hotel also found my girlfriend's jacket that was left behind in the closet, and sent it back at our expense. Overall, I thought the service was good, and the location was excellent. Parking is a bit expensive at $37/night incl tax... but I knew that going in. I wouldn't hesitate recommending this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: WarwickshireMonty
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, and were a little sad to move on. The staff were very helpful, the rooms were comfortable, large and clean. The location of the hotel is very good too, being 10 minutes wlak form the main shopping and eating street (Robson). It is only 15 minutes walk to Gastown. The hotel faces the harbour, and if you have a room which faces that way (we did) the views of the harbour and Grouse Mountain are excellent. You are also only a pleasant stroll from Stanley Park, and they are worth the effort. tThere is a promenade which takes you one way to Stanley Park and the other way to Canada Place and Gastown. There are enough bars along there to rest your legs. Would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “A hidden surprise”
Reviews.Author: Sarah H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal location for walking from the sea plane/Canada Place and exploring Downtown Vancouver. Importantly as a female travelling alone I felt very safe in the hotel and neighbourhood. The rooms are great and modern and very comfy and I requested a sea view which is terrific-looking out across to the snow capped mountains. I ate in the restaurant next door which was great. I asked about a refrigerator in the room and it can be requested for $1/day. The back of the hotel is on a street with the regular buses and easy to link up with the Skytrain . Also a 7/11 shop close by. I would definitely choose to come back to this hotel in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Einsteincat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very new and clean inside. The staff are extremely attentive. My room was spacious and bright and had everything I needed, with a nice big bathroom. I was here for 3 nights in the summer for business. The outdoor pool was a nice place to relax in the busy city. I recommend to anyone staying on business. Also a great location for tourists, but seemed very business oriented to me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Coast Coal Harbour Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bacchanalwomantt
Reviews.Content: A very centrally located hotel in downtown Vancouver. Clean amenities. Our room was spacious, the staff just fantastic, very helpful and friendly. We embrace the compliementary wi-fi in our room, a concept that hasn't yet caught on at other major hotel chains.

Reviews.Title: “Super Stay”
Reviews.Author: kathleen f
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a tour from England and found the staff helpful, clean room and bathroom and bed very comfy. Had dinner in the Prestons Restaurant, very tasty and a reasonable price. Hotel very central for sight seeing. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent way to see Vancouver in 24 hours!”
Reviews.Author: Graces
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Vancouver after travelling on The Canadian from Toronto. We only had one evening and day to see this beautiful city. The location of the Coast made it so easy. Our room had beautiful views of the harbour and waterfront - the staff were great about an early checkin. With the in-room coffee and the gorgeous bath, we re-energized and walked the city, had a scenic stroll from the hotel to Stanley Park (long walk - but saw so much), watched the sea planes taking off and landing on the harbour as we went. In the evening, it was safe and easy to stroll to Robson Street. The next morning we watched the sun come up from the little waterfront park across from the hotel. The staff were very gracious and helpful, the room was sparkling clean, the location made our quick tour of Vancouver easy. Can't recommend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, good value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: ffghffhhjkf
Reviews.Content: Great downtown Vancouver location. Usual amenities. No separate shower, but bathtub shower was clean and serviceable. Comfortable beds. Good size work area. Free wifi. Good temperature control. Nice little sitting area with large windows and city views. You don't get much better than this for $129/night in downtown Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Rude check-in staff.”
Reviews.Author: TRAV224
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I are in Vancouver, we usually stay at a hotel somewhat nearby but in a better location. However, we decided to stay here after reading the reviews about this hotel. Unfortunately we did not feel the same as others did. We are not normally picky with our hotels, but we found that our room was very small for a standard sized room, the pool is tiny and although it is open year-round, it was much too cold to use during winter months. It would have been nice if they also had an indoor pool, like most other hotels in the area. Prestons was nothing to write home about. Location is good, however it is a long walk to Stanley park considering you'd be walking all day at the park then have to walk back to the hotel. The major drawback that set the mood for our vacation was the rude clerk that checked us in, Jose. We are nice people. So I did not understand why he had been really snooty with us. Customer service is a keystone for the success of a business. It makes me wonder if he is the same clerk that a few others have complained about. Jose needs to use words to communicate rather then shaking his head and rolling his eyes. It is too bad as we could've overlooked a few things if the service we received was good. Anyways, it was our first time and last stay at this hotel. We'll stick to our favorite where the service is consistently great.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Modern and Well Located.”
Reviews.Author: mg788
Reviews.Content: Near the West End, almost on the harbor and within walking distance of Stanley Park, this modern, comfortable hotel met all our needs and exceeded many. We'll stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, comfortable, clean hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ELBSeattle
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in various hotels in Vancouver. The Coast Coal Harbour was, by far, the best of the lot. The room was clean, comfortable, well appointed and quiet. The staff was amazingly friendly and helpful. The location is great - we were able to get around quite easily. I was even able to find free street parking a few blocks away. Bonus! We will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “A good location in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: MiaLillooet
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. The hotel is comfortable,clean and well maintained. The staff is friendly and helpful. Our room faced on to West Hastings street, which can be noisy at night. I would request a room not facing the street. We would have liked to have a fridge in the room and bath robes to use the pool and hot tub. The valet parking is almost $34 per day. There are other hotels in the city with cheaper parking. The location is good - Urban Fare store across the road from the hotel. Close to the sea wall at Coal Harbour, within walking distance to Pacific Mall, Canada place, Gastown, Burrard station, sea bus, etc. Overall a good choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Cold Glass Tower”
Reviews.Author: depgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything going for it: reasonably priced, clean, modern, comfortable rooms; phenomenal views of Coal Harbour and North Vancouver; a decent restaurant called Prestons; friendly and helpful staff who always say hello to you, a great location in the downtown near everything, pet-friendly, etc. So why can't I give this hotel a four-star review to match its four-star status? Well, unfortunately downtown Vancouver has gotten extremely noisy due to a population that has more than doubled since the 1980s and the sounds of sea planes and sirens reverberating off of all the glass towers, including hotel rooms with their enormous glass windows allowing all the noise to permeate through them. Unfortunately, the same phenomenon holds true for any glass tower hotel in the downtown, including the Marriott and the Delta. So if you're sensitive to street noise like me, even earplugs won't even suffice. The noisy ventilation system did not help things either. I don't recommend staying downtown unless your partially or fully deaf. Yaletown apparently has the same problem. I'd opt instead for a B&B in the West End, where you'll get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chaili
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with Hotwire and was pleasantly surprised at the welcome I received. I checked in before an engagement and afterwards took my dogs (2) with me to the hotel. When I told them I would have 2 Shuh Tzu with me when I returned the fellow on the desk was disappointed because he wouldn't be there later to see them. Also, in the morning the 2 young men parking cars were really welcoming of my dogs and stopped for a pat. The room was lovely and really clean with huge windows and partial view of the harbour. It was nice and close to the sea wall walk and both my dogs and I enjoyed our morning walk.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, welcoming and helpful”
Reviews.Author: WerdnaHampshire
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in the Coast Coal Harbour after arriving in Vancouver on the Rocky Mountaineer. The hotel is clean, modern, convenient and comfortable - a great base for exploring the city. We found all the Canadians we met on our trip friendly and helpful, but nowhere was this more true than at the Coast Coal Harbour. From check-in to check-out, and everywhere in-between, the staff were unfailingly courteous and keen to help us in whatever way they could. For example, during our stay we tried to locate a particular souvenir for friends back home. A senior member of the hotel staff went to great lengths to try and help us, enlisting the assistance of others and making phone calls to try and track down what we were looking for. This was our first time in a Coast Hotel, but if and when we return to North America we'll certainly try and find a Coast to stay in!

Reviews.Title: “Not my favourite but others miught love iit”
Reviews.Author: MGo186430
Reviews.Content: To me it seemed very oriented to the short stay business sector. Room was pleasant (though no where to sit except at desk). Little storage. Quiet. Probably the main problem was the downtown area which was too quiet after dark - made it worrying to go out alone - with few options for eating in the area. I am also not "in" to rather over-slick reception, even though they were very helpful (eg stored my bags after checkout until I caught plane, and also for a few days when I was off on a side trip). Note that this is my PERSONAL view - people on different sort of trips or different backgrounds might love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissyGryphon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on business. Upon check in was advised that I was receiving an upgrade to a King Superior room. I was a little giddy when I opened the door to the 20th floor (top floor) room facing the inner harbour. Very nice. Room decor is modern and sleek. Very comfortable with all the amenities. Lovely linens on the bed which was very comfortable but a little on the firm side. Bathroom was well equipped with lotion, bath gel and shampoo. Missing however was hair conditioner. If you have long hair and use conditioner be sure to bring your own. The staff at the front desk were fabulous and very friendly. Felt very comfortable. Would highly recommend this property for your stay while in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, modern and a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: beninbrighton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in October. Got upgraded to a corner room with a fantastic view of the harbour. Friendly staff. Great facilities, loved the pool, jacuzzi and gym too. Paid a great price and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DiggoryLondon
Reviews.Content: My wife & myself spent two nights at this hotel it was a fantastic stay. The reception staff were very courteous and highly efficient. The hotel is quite new, it is very bright, modern & clean. The air conditioning was very precise & quiet. We had a large corner room (Room 810) overlooking the street with absolutely no traffic or other noise to be heard through the two external glass walls. Free Internet use in the dedicated 3rd floor business centre. This is a very pleasant hotel in a good location. It is just a short stroll to either Stanley Park, Gastown or the Harbour area. For the more adventurous there are a number of bike hire shops in the vicinity. ($14 for two hours hire) which permit you to utilise the Harbour & Stanley Park designated cycle routes. Five minute walk to the Waterfront Sky Train with a 25 minute direct link to Vancouver airport at a cost of $3.5. There are elevators and escalators to the platform should you have heavy luggage. The train has a clearly marked destination board for the airport where the train terminates so it is a very straightforward journey. Note the best entry point for the train is through the main station building concourse not the small blue glass street terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ian T
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in total, 2 days prior to trip to Vancouver Island and 1 night prior to flight home. Service at hotel was superb as was advice given by front desk staff and concierge whose name I forget, but was really helpful with his advice and tips. Room was immaculate, and site of hotel was perfect for downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Well looked after”
Reviews.Author: starveall
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here after a journey from Lake Louise. Checking in was very courteous and efficient. Room was good and their 'green' credentials were confirmed e.g. big containers of shampoo/bath stuff etc. Concierge help was very good and even a waiter delivering a room service meal was helpful - he offered his advice freely without being pushy. Prestons, the restaurant was good value for money on the one night we ate there. Just 2 mins away from the waterfront and you can enjoy a very pleasant walk here, watching the seaplanes take-off and get a bite to eat. We also walked back from Stanley Park - took a leisurely 40/45 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent interior, location, service and restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: Celitel
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic 4 days stay for us at this place. We picked it because of the location and price, but really loved it because of comfortable and well designed room, nice hot tub outside and great food at the restaurant at the second floor. And location is the still the best - 5 min to Stanley park, Canada place or Robson street.

Reviews.Title: “3 Nights in a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarionBEdmonton
Reviews.Content: As a older Woman on my own, I wanted a safe lovely room with a nice view close to Vancouver Harbour and within walking distance of the Vancouver Train Station. I found just that at this lovely hotel. My room on the 15th floorwas very roomy and forded me a side view of the harbour. The bed was extremely comfortable. Room service was very prompt.the shower was nice and hot daily. The Desk service and Concierge were quite helpful with directions and suggestions. All in all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii2009for3
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at this hotel, and my 30th trip to Vancouver. GREAT location! It was within walking distance to shopping and great restaurants! The staff were friendly and knowledgeable of the area, and very quick to respond to any needs. If you need to do any drycleaning, the hotel is practically at your door before you hang up the phone from calling the front desk. Amazingly quick service! For the first time ever I had a room where they took "environmentally conscious" to an entirely new level. My room had a recycling bin, green bin (organic waste) and waste can. It's so nice to have this option in such a great hotel. The conference room in the hotel was very bright and open, and didn't feel like you were in some cardboard box during the week long meetings I had. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend!”
Reviews.Author: P L
Reviews.Content: It was our first time at this hotel and I was pleasantly surprised. Staff was friendly and rooms were nice although ours was a little small. It's close to the waterfront and there is a great walkway along the water for great views of seaplanes and Stanley Park. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific short stay”
Reviews.Author: movedalot
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and were lucky enough to have a room with an amazing view! Large comfortable bed - large room with room to move about and spread out our luggage. We were not a cruise ... we used to live in Vancouver and were back for a visit. The staff were friendly, helpful and polite and gave great advise about dinner reservations and lent us umbrellas. Unlimited net use was really helpful! Had some great walks down to Stanley Park - breakfast over the road at Urban Fare and excellent coffees up at Cafe Artigiano. We left town and came back and they graciously held onto a bag for us.

Reviews.Title: “Very well situated , good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ProspectGeoff
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the end of a long Canadian tour, and although tired we found the hotel restful, comfortable and beautifully situated so that we could get everywhere around town with no problem ( we were carless). It is recently redecorated and the staff seem to be proud of it. Near the waterfront, it is also close to stop 1 on ther two city-buses hop-on-hop-off. Shopping is on the doorstep and many restaurants are nearby. A lovely way to end our holiday

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great part of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Sameron
Reviews.Content: Renovated in January 2010, this is a modern, clean hotel. Everything feels new and we were very pleased with our room which had not one but two double beds. The location is great and the staff friendly and helpful. Parking isn't cheap at $50 for 2 nights and it's valet but I guess the Coast isn't alone in charging for parking and given where the hotel is located I can understand the need for charging. This is a great base to explore Vancouver and I highly recommend you give it a try if you're in this neck of the woods.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Radarz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very nice place. Clean, quiet and the facilities are everything you would want. We stayed here the night before we left on a cruise and was chosen particularly for the proximity to the Cruise ship terminal. Having said that, the terminal is about 5-10 mins walk from the motel and if you are OK carrying/wheeling your luggage that far then you will be OK. Staff were very friendly and the room was excellent. Nice view of the city. Hotel is not very old and situated right in the middle of downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: savannahsue
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel from researching Trip Advisor and were extremely satisfied with our experiences. Hotel is well located near Canada Place cruise terminal, shops, restaurants, coffee shops and currency exchange. Front desk staff were helpful and speedy, rooms are larger than usual, squeaky clean and big bathrooms with adjustable shower head and nice big bottles of toiletries instead of those midgets. In-room safe worked easily, drapes closed out sunlight and our only problem was a noisy air conditioner. The hotel restaurant offered plenty of entree choices for dinner and competitive prices. It also serves breakfast and lunch. We found two nearby (1/2 block away) coffee shops offering fresh baked pastries instead. Hop on/hop off bus tickets can be bought at front desk; stop is a block away. This is a great way to see a lot of Vancouver in one day. This hotel is very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: slig0r0ver
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Coast Coal Harbour Hotel for 3 nights at the end of August and found it to be an excellent accommodation in a central location in Vancouver. All the downtown sights and shopping are within easy walking distance and public transport is also close-by. Hop on a No.19 bus outside the hotel for the short ride to Stanley Park which is a must-see. Staff were warm and welcoming and prepared to take the effort to advise us on any queries which we had, particularly in relation to tourism and transport issues. Hotel has a nice contemporary, modern feel. Our room on the 14th floor was spacious and had a good view of both harbour and mountains,and compared to some other hotels in this location offers very good value, costwise. Would have no problem in recommending this hotel to anyone who wants a central base yet still away from the bustle of Robson St.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Vancouver city trip”
Reviews.Author: GerdM46
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much, we had a nice modern room with a wonderful harbour view. Hotel is in walking distance to many locations downtown. Public transport - Bus 19 round the corner if you are tired of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: LJSKWiltshire
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are friendly and efficient. We arrived and were informed we had been given a complimentary upgrade. The room was great with a lovely view of the harbour. The location is perfect - away from the hustle of the city but within a 5/10 minute walk of restaurants and the harbour. The attached restaurant was excellent with an nice setting and lovely food. Definitely use this hotel again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: m12-c4
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here. Great location, close to the harbour where we went on a sunset dinner cruise one night. Close to stanley park and the sea wall and a great location downtown. It is within walking distance of bars and restuarants, we walked back every night after eating and drinking and was very safe. We were given a voucher for a freebie in Prestons and we went one night, we couldn't use the voucher and it wasn't really worth a visit so i wouldn't recommend eating there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AMRSA
Reviews.Content: Modern & clean, spacious rooms, friendly staff, good food at the restaurant and great location! I would definitely stay here again when I visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny room.”
Reviews.Author: jillygo
Reviews.Content: We booked our reservation on Hotwire which was a critical fail. Hotwire rooms are the tiniest rooms at this property. We could have had a far superior room, for the same price, had we booked through the hotels internet deal. They would not gift us with a better room - you get what you get. Brought a blow-up mattress for the kid. The location is superior, the property was quiet and the conciege/valet staff was outstanding. We walked or biked everywhere. We would not return to Vancouver in August, it was high tourist season.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it !!!”
Reviews.Author: joannel1234
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, wonderful staff and great location!! Beautiful hotel. Only blocks from Canada Place. If we ever go to Vancouver again we would definitely stay here again. The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful with directions and suggestions of what to do!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - see if you can get a room with a view”
Reviews.Author: WVillageTraveller
Reviews.Content: Happened to get a room with a beautiful view (I suppose it was a partial view but still) of the water and could see the boats going by, seagulls circling and sea planes coming in. Fantastic bonus and generally a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Tnapora
Reviews.Content: I stay in Vancouver a lot. This hotel gives great value for what you pay. Pool and hottub are heated but outside. Next time I plan to request a room with a terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay....loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Britgirl777
Reviews.Content: We booked a websaver deal on the Coast's website and got a really good rate for a standard room. We got to the hotel at the check in time and they made a mistake and sent us to a room that was still being cleaned. Apologized immediately and upgraded us to a superior room which was lovely....had an ocean view over Coal Harbour. The hotel is quite new and is very nice...has an outdoor pool which is small but more than adequate for the kids and the location is lovely. Coal Harbour is my new favourite place in Vancouver.....beautiful!! The only downside is that valet parking is a bit pricey at $37. All in all though a fantastic stay. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: wannabeinkona
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before a cruise and it was in a great location to Canada place. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the rooms were lovely. Our stay here got the trip off on the right note.
