Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: mtbcli
Reviews.Content: Our family loves to travel to Vancouver (2 boys aged 7, 10). We have stayed at the Bayshore, Pan Pacific, Marriott and Hyatt. On this trip, we decided to try The Coast Coal Harbour Hotel based on all the positive reviews on Tripadvisor. It was hands down the best. Great location, close to the waterfront, Stanley Park, Robson Street and even a spray park that was only about 1 block away. Check-in was very easy and the desk staff were very helpful. We decided to go with the Premium room since you have more space and a great view. It was worth the extra money. The room was on the 19th floor and it was huge, very clean and modern. The boys had their own little area with a TV. We had floor to ceiling windows with a great view of Stanley Park. The boys loved watching the sea planes land and take off. I didn’t use the gym since I like to run outside but it looked quite nice. The boys liked the pool. I was thrilled with FREE wireless internet. We would certainly go back here.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: judith081
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 weeks ago and loved it.The room was lovely,good sized,clean and well furnished.The bathroom was also good.We enjoyed the pool and hot tub,usually had them to ourselves.Our room on the 9th floor had a view of the water so we could see the sea planes coming in and out.Hotel security was excellent , we needed to use our room card to use the lifts/access the pool etc.Staff at reception and room staff were friendly and helpful.Situated in a nice area and within walking distance to a lot of attractions.We would recommend this hotel to any-one going to Vancouver and would go back again ourselves

Reviews.Title: “Great Time here and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Aussie8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coast Coal for 1 night before our cruise and 3 nights after the cruise. The hotel is modern and clean. For the night before the cruise we had a room facing the office blocks but this did not worry us. After the cruise we had booked a superior king room and this was on the 12th floor with a view of the harbour between the buildings. Lovely! Checkin was smooth and the desk staff were very helpful. On the return from the cruise we left our bags at the front desk (it was 9.30am) and came back later to check in-no problem. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. The beds and pillows were great! All staff were friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back again and again!”
Reviews.Author: Cattledogs
Reviews.Content: In 2010, we stayed in Fairmont Pacific Rim and we encountered a typical big hotel problems - no rooms ready after the check-in time, and a concierge with a major attutude. The room and the other staff including the engineer staff were great but there was no personal feel that you get in a smaller boutique hotels. So this time, I decided to try this new green hotel. What a great hotel and the staff!!! Each staff was great, but especially Jeremiah at the front desk. He took a time to explain about the sight seeing spots for us in details. When we told him that we were not interested in a tour, he told us the way to see two attractions using the free shuttles and a public bus. Sometimes hotels uses "being green" as an excuse for lack of comfort etc. but not this hotel. It is very clean, and very comfortable, and very GREEN. The shampoo and shower jell were in the large bottles, and there were three garbage baskets - one for garbage, one for recycle, and one for compost. Now one for compost really impressed me! How many times have I regretfully thrown a banana peel into a trash! Here I did not have to! This will be going to my choice hotel in Vancouver!!

Reviews.Title: “This brand new hotel is very good”
Reviews.Author: Erik1969
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two days. Enjoyed the helpfull staff (left a photo camera in a cab, but the staff acted so quickly that we had it back in minutes, thanks again!!), spacious room with a ocean view and good beds , swimming pool, gym and free fast and reliable wireless internet. The hotel is close to the waterfront, Stanley park, shops and all other places that are of interest. We would certainly go back here.

Reviews.Title: “centrally located in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Anja_S_DE
Reviews.Content: Newly (2009) built hotel, stylish, spacious rooms. The hotel is located centrally in downtown Vancouver, just some footsteps from harbour and marina and Robson Street (Shopping), Stanley Park and Gastown are also in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “We had a fantastic stay and would definately go back again”
Reviews.Author: annday26
Reviews.Content: This hotel had to be one of the friendliest and helpful hotels I have ever stayed in. The reception staff just couldn't do enough to help us enjoy our stay. We were given some great information and advice on which places to visit from personal experiences, and they certainly did get our approval. Jeramiah was a real gem, I bonded with him immediately; he gave us the thumbs up on Granville Island, which turned out to be just like a bohemian oasis in a sea of high rise buildings, wonderful, comfortable and well worth a visit. We spent many a lovely evening in Prestons restaurant in the hotel, and we were surprised and pleased to see that they had Vindaloo curry on the menu. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So modern and sleek, and the bed! Heaven.”
Reviews.Author: Shan3034
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night before leaving on a cruise. Wish we could have stayed longer. That bed was the perfect antidote for our east coast jet lag. Loved the blues and whites of the decor. Didn't get the chance to try out the pool or the amenities. The location was great for an early morning jog to Stanley Park. Hotel staff was very nice and helpful for recommendations of where to eat. Would stay here again if I return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, location and standard. What more could you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: mark2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in June 2011. We had a lot to pack in to our stay so we really appreciated the helpful front desk staff who ensured our room was available and organised tickets for the complimentary bus to the Capilano Suspension Bridge that was due to depart just 45 minutes after our arrival at the hotel. Not sure when the hotel was built but the newness hasn't worn off. The rooms are very clean and furnished to a good standard. Location is excellent - one street back from the harbour. At the 'better' end of town, close to the marina and handy for the shopping area. We found dining options nearby limited but enjoyed the food in the cafe at the supermarket opposite (strange I know but don't knock it until you've tried it!). This was an encouraging start to our holiday in Canada as we had reservations with other hotels in this group during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great 5 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Discerning1001
Reviews.Content: Had a large room on the 19th floor with views through the floor to ceiling windows over to North Vancouver and across to Stanley park over the marina. The room was clean, contemporary and very comfortable.The bathroom was large and with good storage. We got breakfast each day from Urban Fare just across the street and took it back to the room. It was lovely taking in the view with a leisurely start to the day. Staff at the hotel were very helpful in all respects: housekeeping were very quick to respond to requests, the front desk was efficient and the concierge service was excellent for restaurant recommendations and bookings. Would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everthing”
Reviews.Author: pierre44Montreal
Reviews.Content: Well located, this hotel offers excellet opportunities to visit Vancouver, Gastown, Stanley Park, Canada Place, shopping on Robson street and more. Rooms are comfortables and the personel is always there to help. Good to know : pool, jacuzzi, fitness room. A new park along the bay and besides the convention is a great place to take a walk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tommy-1955
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay in town as we were going to a concert and she got a deal thru some internet site. Our room was nice and fairly large - a mini fridge and microwave would have been nice (maybe available in other rooms). The staff was very attentive. Parking (Valet) was a tad expensive but probably the norm in the area. Our room faced into the city but I would think rooms on the north side would get a partial view of the harbour & mountains. We could see the outdoor pool (approx 3rd floor) and it looked ok. The location was great - 1 block from the waterfront where you can walk to Stanley Park or the Convention Centre. It is about 3 blocks up to Robson Street and a couple blocks to the Burrard Skytrain Station which in our case was excellent for getting to & from Rogers Centre for the concert.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveller1609
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning after a long flight before embarking on a cruise out of Vancouver and the staff went out of their way to ensure that our room was available before the normal check-in time which was greatly appreciated. Our room was clean, stylish, and quite spacious and included free wireless internet and a clock radio with an iPod plug in. The restaurant meals were excellent and very reasonably priced and the service could not be faulted. Overall, this was a most pleasant stay and we would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stanleycromo
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay was in a great area can walk to stanley park from here staff are friendly and very helpful with directions etc . We loved the pool and hottub but most of all we fell in love with Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay - we will be back”
Reviews.Author: isajul
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in Vancouver's Coast Coal Harbour Hotel and it was definitely beyond our expectations! It was one of the our last minute decisions to book in a hotel within the city and boy, were we glad we did.The hotel was luxurious, centrally and conveniently located to the must-see attractions like Robson St and Robson Square. Olympic Park, Stanley Seawall, Convention Center, etc. Very reasonably priced. Despite of it being a business hotel, it had a cozy feel of it being great for families as well. We were fortunately billeted at a corner room w/ good views of the harbor and the staff was most hospitable and helpful in more ways than one! Wanted to give special mention to Mr. Romy Herrera, the hotel comptroller who was quite welcoming and accomodating! Gave us a good insight on Vancouver and the highlights to see as seen by a local. Also, the people at the Front Desk and 2 concierge personnel named Ken, (i think) who was doing our valet parking for us. Always ready to give us personalized suggestions as how we made the most of our 3 day-2 night stay in the city. Amazing how in that span of time, we were able to do a quick bike ride along Stanley Park Seawall, have a quick visit to the beaches, go to Capilano Suspension Bridge, Kitsilano Beach and the Granville Islands and sample the best seafood a harbour city like Vancouver can offer. The hotel restaurant/bar was likewise an outlet to try. The food was exemplary and quite decently priced, with impressive service staff. If one is travelling on business, one can easily unwind in the very clean and well maintained gym, hot tub and pool. All in all, a great hotel to stay in. So, if you are looking for a hotel with the luxury feel to it, w/ personalized service and yet have that homey feel which a family can likewise enjoy, be it on business or pleasure, this is the hotel we totally suggest you look into! Thank you again, Romy and staff for a most wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Business meet family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peggyelee
Reviews.Content: Accompanied spouse on business trip with kids. Pleasantly surprised on how well the staff were so cool and nice with kiddos. Pool was not big but perfect for an afternoon swim. Rooms were clean and well kept. Close to attractions as well as convention center. Nice mix.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences!”
Reviews.Author: Clairezilla
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before we embarked on a cruise out of Vancouver and it was a great experience! When we checked in, the front desk clerk went above and beyond to make sure we had an excellent stay. The views from the hotel are beautiful (ours was a water view). The hotel was also very conscious about the environment which I liked. They had trash cans separated out for recycling as well as other eco-friendly additions. Our room was clean, stylish, and had every modern desire including free wireless internet and a clock radio with an iPod plug in. The price was also very reasonable when compared with other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot to end our BC tour”
Reviews.Author: jt0475
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the very last night of our BC/Alaska trip, and were in need of a comfortable, relaxing environment, and this provided it. We ate in Preston's restaurant, which is part of the complex (as we found out whilst wandering around deciding on where to eat!). Rooms were very spacious, beds comfortable (and massive). Only downside was the size of the bath - but this seems to be a feature of downtown Vancouver hotels - we have stayed in a few, and the baths all seem to be fairly small! Beware of parking fees however - this is quite pricey, but for the convenience, along with the valet parking service, worth it at the end of a long days travelling. We were lucky enough to have a view of the harbour, but I would think you may struggle in some of the other rooms to be honest - our daughters were overlooking another tower block, but they weren't too bothered as they were pretty tired out by the time we arrived in the city anyway, but something people should be aware of.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: NJB-10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! The location was ideal for sightseeing, shopping, restaurants and very close to the harbor. Everything was new and beautiful and we loved the minimalist style. When we checked in our requested room was overbooked so we were upgraded to a suite (with a balcony with a harbor view)! The fitness room, pool and hot tub were other nice perks. We found the staff to be very welcoming and helpful. Next time we visit we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luv_2_xlr8
Reviews.Content: I came across this hotel accidentaly on my second visit to Vancouver. Even though our office is located in Burnaby this hotel was worth the 20 min Sky Train ride in to Burnaby. The location of this hotel is nothing short of being fantastic. Your a block a way from the water and the park. Some really great restaurants is the area and 15 min walk to the Waterfront Train Station, which links directly to the Vancouver airport - a great cost saving if you want to pay for a taxi. This hotel is also close to the Vancouver Olympic flame, Convention Center, Stanley Park, Gas Town and almost anything else that you really need to see in Vancouver. Unfortunately the rooms that i have stayed in didn't have the greatest view but when you go for work, you rarely get a chance to enjoy the room or a view. I would high recommend this hotel to anyone that is thinking of going to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: sixstrings1974
Reviews.Content: The staff was very courteous and helpful with all our questions. They provided an upgraded room at no extra charge due to lack of availability of the room we booked.Great view from the 19th floor looking out into the harbour and mountains in the background. Very clean room and good guest services. 7-11,Grocery Market, Drug Store, and Eateries are all within a couple of blocks walking distance. The waterfront and float planes are also within reasonable walking distance too.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, quiet lobby, good location”
Reviews.Author: susi37
Reviews.Content: As stated in the title, we got a very good deal on two rooms at the Coast Coal Harbour Hotel in downtown Vancouver. They were clean, attractive, and spacious. The hotel is located in walking distance to Stanley Park (gorgeous place to visit), O' Canada, Robson Street shopping area, and the Gastown. The lobby is teeny tiny so it's not a place where you can sit, relax, and read the local newspaper. The health club looked well stock with updated equipment, although we didn't use it. The pool is outdoors, but is heated. We were disappointed because some "idiots" pulled the emergency life preserver off the wall and it shut down the jacuzzi for safety reasons. When we arrived at the jacuzzi, the alarm was blaring. We called down to the main desk, they already knew. We waited for someone to come and shut it off so we could use the facilities, but after 20 minutes we left (So sad!!); otherwise, all was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: borntourist
Reviews.Content: We stayed there before a cruise. Room was comfortable, and we loved the spa products. The fitness center was well equipped and clean. We ate at the restaurant the service and food were great. Would recommend it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: kwaelder
Reviews.Content: Spending a couple of days in Vancouver during a summer tour of the pacific northwest, I found myself pleasantly surprised at the value afforded by the Coast Coal Harbour Hotel. With a great location in downtown, I found the hotel a great launching point for walking tours around the city and driving tours to North and West Vancouver. The front desk was welcoming... polished and professional, check-in and check-out were nice experiences... Service was courteous and smart. The contemporary room was not especially large, but was nicely appointed and impeccably maintained. Views on the lower floors are a bit confined. Beds we bright and supremely comfortable after a day of hiking on Grouse Mountain and touring of the city on foot. Ample desk and storage space were welcomed whether catching up on email or sorting out souvenirs. The bath was a well-lit contemporary affair with all the requisite accoutrements... this place was stocked better than bigger luxury brand hotels! The soft-soap in the shower was a nice departure from the norm. A light casual traveler, I like to hand wash some of my casual wear as I go to ease up on my luggage burden... It would have been nice to have a retractable clothes line in the bath for such. Spending only two nights with rather full days of touring, I did not have occasion to avail myself of room service or amenities, though I would not hesitate to book another stay at the Coast Coal Harbour Hotel should I find myself in Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a Lifetime”
Reviews.Author: DannyHertfordshire
Reviews.Content: This was a birthday present from my husband and it couldn't get much better than this. We traveled with Titan Tours and were fully escorted from our door to Vancouver. Vancouver was our first stop and the hotel was superb as was Vancouver, so clean and so much to see. Next, we traveled to Victoria which again was lively. 1 night in Kelowna, not much there but then on to lovely Jasper,the Rockies then Banff and finally Calgary. It was what memories are made of and our Canadian driver and Tour Manager have to be applauded and because of them everything ran smoothly. I highly recommend Titan Tours for being so informative before the trip and giving us value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasurable Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: cross1242
Reviews.Content: This hotel is relatively new -- only about a year or two old. It has all of the amenities expected of a first-class hotel. Included are a restaurant, a spa, meeting rooms, etc. The front desk staff and the bellmen are all very good at explaining how to get around the town. Our room was on the 9th floor and had a great view of the harbor including the seaplane base. (Which is interesting to watch.) The bed is large and comfortable. There are plenty of restaurants nearby. (Try the "Coast" restaurant at 1054 Alberni Street for the best seafood anywhere in the world.) The hotel is close to Stanley Park

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location - what more could you ask for”
Reviews.Author: KathMacca
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in July and cannot fault it one bit. Great room with all the facilities, including free WIFI and great views over the harbour and Grouse Mountain. Location is perfect for Stanley Park, getting the bus to Granville Island, the Convention centre for the free shuttle bus to Grouse and Capalino bridge and Robson and Alberni Street for all the restaurants. Cannot recommend this enough and would definately stay here again. We went over to Comox to see friends for one night on the float plane and the hotel were more than happy to keep out luggage for us which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for short stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Mike1946
Reviews.Content: Very good quality hotel, well run and efficient, good location to the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and stylish hotel, close to the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Katti17
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights. The rooms are clean and stylish. There is not much space for the clothing. It's well located and you can walk to Stanley park and to Waterfront. It takes only five minutes to Robson Street- a nice shoppingstreet. The hotel has a little swimming-pool in the fifth floor and it's possible to use the internet and print for example the boarding passes. We have been a bit upset that we should pay a half room price for a later check-out- after four nights staying. But we were offered to keep our luggage in the hotel and to use the swimming-pool area to change clothes and to take a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveller3204
Reviews.Content: We had just one night in this hotel and wished we were staying longer. We had a fabulous corner room with floor to ceiling windows and great views of the bay and city. Very spacious room, clean and with lovely bathroom toiletries. Close to everything, including float plane, which we took to Victoria the next morning. Very helpful staff. We didn't eat at the hotel, but had a late night drink in the bar area. Great service and nice atmosphere. We'd definately stay here again when next we travel to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, one block from Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Fernie01
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, trendy and modern decor. Very helpful front desk and other staff encountered. Wonderful location, just a block from the waterfront area, close to Stanley Park and also Robson St. Only complaint was there was no fridge in the room. Front desk told me that they do have some, which upon request, you may receive one (ie. for medical reasons). They say they do not have them to save on the environment. More likely their own pockets! Sorry, for over $200 per night, I'd like a fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous spacious corner rooms in a well-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: london_traveller062
Reviews.Content: Im a 40-something english guy who travels a reasonable amount for work and for pleasure. Stayed for 2 nights in June 2011 with a friend. CC Harbour punches above its weight / cost with v large stylish rooms, lovely service and good location Things we liked about the hotel : - we both had corner rooms with floor to ceiling glass windows. they felt posh and special. Def 5 star space. good beds and v well equipped ( I particularly liked the range of teas coffees inc proper filter coffee to go ). loved the free wifi, ipod doc and - a nice touch - 3 bins for recycling. ahead of the curve - large, well equipped and clean bathrooms - consistently lovely service. no question was unimportant to the front of house staff Minor quibbles : - SPARSE. the lobby felt cavernous, a bit loud and under-decorated. We arrived at the same time as a group and it felt like a bus station.Lifts felt like service lifts ie big and empty. The bathrooms were huge but again felt empty with no pictures / softening features. It wouldn't cost that much to fix that to make it feel like a 5 star hotel at a 4 star price. It just felt a little as tho the money had run out at that point. - the valet parking was a bit expensive - the breakfasts were good quality but - v un-n.american - too small - portions - my room was cleaned v late one day. Overall : v good value for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “TOP NOTCH @ THE COAST COAL HARBOUR”
Reviews.Author: Yogi_L
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfection all around. I stayed in a Premium suite and LOVED it! The bed was amazing, the view was amazing, the bath tub was amazing. It was very beautiful, clean, and modern. The service...oh the service! Top notch service from the entire staff and it never stopped. The turn down service was lovely. I came into my rm after an entire day out to soft music playing, chocolates on my bed, my curtains closed, a fresh bottle of water, and a light on. The room service was also top notch, and the food was DELISH! I, unfortunately did not try Prestons (the restaurant) but I did try both the gym and the pool. Both were LOVELY. The location is just perfect with short walks to all amenities and beautiful Vancouver sights. I would stay at the Coast again in a heart beat. In fact, I was quite sad to have to return home!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location - close to the water”
Reviews.Author: GCPicnic
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June - great hotel in great location. Staff very helpful, breakfast was nice and room was very comfortable. Location is one block back from the harbour front. Close to Stanley Park and the cycle hire company !! Easy walk into the cruise terminal precinct. Lots of food options around - great whole food deli nearby........would def. stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel..excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: djZ2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights for business...very good, clean and modern hotel with all amenities...the staff is exceptionally friendly and goes out of its way to help out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: hctravelers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night pre-cruise. Couldn't have chosen a better location. Arrived earlier than the designated check in time, but it wasn't a problem. We had booked the least expensive room thru orbitz, which meant that we prepaid for the room. When we arrived we asked for a room with a great view as this was our first time to Vancouver. We were told that our room was in the back of the hotel looking at the city, but the great views are in the front of the hotel, which is an upgraded room. So they ask us if we wanted to upgrade for $30 and we did so (when we checked out, they actually did not even charge us for the upgrade). Our room was on floor 11 and it was looking out over the Coast Coal Harbour. Even though the view was between 2 buildings, it was still a great view. The check in staff was very friendly, and the bellhop delivered our bags for us promptly. We walked along the harbour, viewed the incoming/outgoing ships and seaplanes. Got coffee and pastries at Tim Hortons, ate a late lunch as there were numerous choices all within walking distance. We returned for a nap late afternoon, but the beds were so comfortable that we slept thru the night. Rooms are decorated with minimal accessories, but had everything we needed. One of the cleanest hotel bathrooms I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Saty”
Reviews.Author: HabsFan21
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Fairly new, very modern rooms. Excellent location, right in Coal Harbour, steps to Robson Street shopping and Stanley Park. The gym was so-so, not the best, just average. Staff were great, very friendly. Great room for well under $200/night

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest Hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: heather47
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel, extremely clean. Fanstaicly comfy bed in a lovely location. Couldn't ask for anything else. We were on 16th floor had a superior room with a lovely view

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Lw2309
Reviews.Content: Fabulous rooms, nice rooftop hot tub and pool. I'm so glad we picked this hotel. There is a 7/11 convenience store just down the road which is great for snacks. The nicest hotel I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable start to holiday”
Reviews.Author: Tynes1der
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the business district of Vancouver close to the sea-front, but a 10 minute walk uphill to the main shops. There are good bus services close by. We were booked in for 3 nights as part of a Titan Hitours group. We were checked in and in our room within 10 minutes and our cases arrived 5 minutes later. The room was spacious with 2 large double beds, good quality furnishings, 42" digital TV, free WiFi and a good sized bathroom with excellent quality toiletries. Unfortunately there was only a single bedside cabinet between the beds with a central double light that shone on both beds which ever side was turned on. WE therefore used both beds so that we had access to the light and beside cabinet. (There should be a cabinet and individual on both sides of each bed so that they can be used as doubles). This turned out to be typical of Canadian hotel rooms on this tour. There was also only one suitcase stand - not ideal for 2 guests living out of 2 suitcases. There was the usual hair dryer, ironing board and tea/coffee supplies (limited milk and sugar). The window overlooked office blocks at the back - no problem as we ere not there for the view! We were served a complimentary continental breakfast in a meeting room so cannot comment on the normal breakfast. We though that the dinner options were typically pricey as expected in a 4* hotel so ate out. (Vancouver is NOT a cheap place to eat anyway).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: BobbyIND
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my two kids 11 and 9. The location is excellent. A little few blocks away from the main market streets and very near the waterfront. In fact I would say being away from the market streets is a positive as it is very quiet and relaxing. And being near the waterfront is excellent as one can really take lovely walks in the mornings and evenings. And you are not that far from the market streets in any case its just a short walk to holp across for shopping or a meal. Lovely newly done up rooms and very spacious. Most spacious infact in my entire trip. Loved the big toiletry bottles in the bathroom. First time seen such containers in a hotel. The ceiling to floor windows are great - but in evenings one can see across the windows of buildings opposite you so I guess even those people can see inside your rooms. Though they are office buildings and no one is really interested but still maybe some privacy issues here. Had done a non-refundable booking for 3 nights but due to change in travel plans stayed only for 2 nights. The hotel refused for a refund/room upgrade/food voucher. It is not against my booking rules but still a small gesture might have been appreciated. But woudl come back here again. Loved the hotel and more so Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: briers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a group travelling to Rockies. Good location for being near harbour -bit of a walk to the shops though. Room was clean and well maintained. Restaurant attached to hotel was good value for money and great didnt have far to go after a 9 hour flight.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Rania0722
Reviews.Content: I experienced the same poor customer service as others noted here. The staff at the front desk need to be trained in proper customer service and etiquette. For a hotel that is trying to compete at a 4 star level it is doing a poor job. Upon notifying the hotel of my late arrival I was not offered assistance with any of my bags, I was told at check in that if I was going to have 3 people in my room that I needed to pay a $25/night 3rd person fee even though this was never mentioned before and the third person was my aunt who was simply visiting. She told the genteleman at the front desk that in that case (keeping in mind that we are exhausted and its 3 am) she would take some bags up and wouldnt be staying. He replied " then I can expect you to come down shortly?" What a first impression! Having spent the days prior to this at the Four Seasons Downtown it is clear that this hotel pales in comparison not to mention the location is not so convenient. Spare yourselves the fake attempt at service and stay at the other 4 star hotels in Downtown Vancouver for sure!

Reviews.Title: “I'm glad I picked this one”
Reviews.Author: mojave_ben
Reviews.Content: Conference at the convention center. TA reviews of this hotel sounded good, so I picked it over the conference-negotiated hotels. I really enjoyed it. I had a corner room with lots of windows and, though the views were mostly of other buildings, I could see a bit of harbour, which was nice. The beds were great and the room ultra quiet (my main concern when traveling). No fridge but plenty of ice. In room recycling. Free good wifi (Many Vancouver hotels charge). About 8 minute walk from the Skytrain station, 5 minutes from the convention center. Grocery store just kitty-corner on Bute St - its upscale and has good food. Just a block away from the hotel you are in the harborfront park, which has peds out till late at night, so it must be safe. You're about 3/4 mile from Stanley Park, which is wonderful if you want to wander outdoors. Lots of little restaurants of various types within a few blocks. No fancy lobby here, just utilitarian. Staff were friendly. Restaurant is very good. Used business center to print boarding passes. I really liked the feel of the hotel and the room - glass, airy, clean, modern.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!! Great People!!!”
Reviews.Author: SanFranBaby
Reviews.Content: Hello I actually work at the Fairmont in San Francisco. If I’m not mistaken asking for the name of any additional person(s) staying in the room is standard procedure around the world for security and emergency reasons….example: a fire in the hotel they would need a list of names to find you. My hotel in Vancouver was sold out a few weeks ago when I needed it. I also booked through Hotwire to get a cheaper rate….if you read the fine print or see their commercials it says you get what you get….basically the left over rooms which indicates you get the hotels basic room. I find when I travel to Canada they normally give rooms with two queens or two doubles whereas USA gives King Rooms more often. I really don’t mind paying for the upgrade as it was only $30 a night and I only paid roughly $100 a night for the room. That same room was $230 before taxes (WARNING: Canada has a lot of TAX on everything) if I paid regular price!!!! I saved $100 each night!!! Now that was a deal! I ended up staying at the Coast Coal Harbor Hotel as well and my experience was the opposite…the service was exceptional…….can’t believe I’m saying this but I think if I was going to rate a hotel on service, the Coast would get 100%. Everyone from the Front desk to Housekeeping were great! Highly Recommended!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: greatbeyond
Reviews.Content: There is definitely an overall business feel to the hotel and it's modern but it's not uninviting. Rooms and bathroom were clean and a nice size. The bathroom did not have hair conditioner though. Staff is good - definitely some friendlier than others but no one was rude. I will say that one of them sent us out to Commercial Drive to a restaurant that was not open (in the sense that it wasn't ready to be open) so I'm not sure why they didn't know that but we ended up at another bar/restaurant out there and saw a different part of Vancouver so it wasn't lost. Fitness center is a good size and I'm pretty sure 24 hours. The pool is fine but it's outside on the 5th floor and feet away from office windows next door. So it was a little odd when we saw it. Also, even though it was slightly heated, it was way too cold to use so that was unfortunate. Location is awesome. You're right downtown and near everything and can walk almost everywhere. We were on the 10th floor so our view was of the offices across the street which wasn't great. But we didn't spend much time in the room so it didn't bother us. Wi-fi was free and fast and they had a business center (which we didn't use). They have complimentary umbrellas for that pesky rainy weather. Parking was $37 overnight which sucked. But all the valets were really great and helpful. Also, there's a little market type place called Urban Fare to get a reasonably priced breakfast right down Hastings at Bute if you don't want to put out money for the breakfast at the hotel. I liked it overall!

Reviews.Title: “Small & spartan rooms but a great location”
Reviews.Author: BlackberryBoy
Reviews.Content: Like the last reviewer, I booked this hotel through Hotwire. Hotwire lists this as a 4 star property but it's really more like a 3 or a 3.5 star (I've stayed at much nicer Hiltons in the States that were only listed as 3.5 and have found Hotwire has been fibbing their stars lately). We had very friendly service at check-in and were informed that we could upgrade to a larger room for an extra fee but we decided to chance the basic rooms. The key word here is basic! Our room had barely enough room for two double beds, it was one of the smallest rooms I've ever stayed in. The bathroom had nice toiletries but it too was tiny! I didn't mind since we got a great deal but if you're paying full price you might want to consider another property. The hotel is less than a year old so everything is new but the room was on level with a Holiday Inn in terms of comfort and polish. The beds really were tiny and we ended up taking one each which wasn't so nice. A word of advice, there is actually a small amount of free street parking available within a block of this hotel. We were lucky enough to snag a spot (in front of the townhouses one block closer to the water) which saved a lot of money. Parking is also free at the metered spots form 10:00pm to 9:00am so if you plan on being out during the day you might want to consider this as an option as well. Although I wasn't very impressed with the hotel I will say the location is perfect, as already mentioned there is the chance of snagging free parking, Stanley Park is close by, the convention centre is a block away and the main part of downtown is a few blocks to the East as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic hotel, snotty staff.”
Reviews.Author: sarafish81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in April. The location itself is great - right downtown and only steps away from the water. The room we were in was basic but clean and modern. My problem with the hotel concern the price of parking ($35 a night which is high) and the staff. We booked this through hotwire.com and brought in our confirmation when we checked in. My husband's name was on the confirmation and so he did the talking. The front desk clerk (a small, snotty little man), looked me up and down and asked "are you staying here too?" I looked at my husband and back at the clerk and said, "uh, yeah, does it not say 2 people on the reservation?" He ignored my question and then wanted my name. We've stayed at a lot of hotels and I've never been asked that. When we arrived in our room, we noticed that there were only 2 double beds -- I've never stayed at a hotel with 2 double beds. My husband called the front desk as we thought we should have just one queen or king bed and the lovely man who checked us in informed us snottily that "due to the fact that you booked this through a DISCOUNT WEBSITE (snotty voice) and not the hotel directly, you are given our basic room". I've stayed a lot of places (for example a Holiday Inn Express) with much better customer service than we had here. The cleaning staff were efficient and the pool/hot tub was nice, but I wouldn't stay here or recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad business hotel”
Reviews.Author: roomservice99
Reviews.Content: I can't say anything bad about that hotel. I think some reviews here are overly positive good. It's simply a modern and clean business hotel and I enjoyed my stay. Nice view. Free wireless. Only thing maybe: Valet parking was 33 CAD (before tax) while the brochure in the room said 29 (or even 28, can't remember) I recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: miiiiiike
Reviews.Content: As soon as you enter the loby this hotel feels new, modern and friendly staff. The room was very clean, an amazing bed, up to date and a sweet view of coal harbor. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, good location”
Reviews.Author: mrmark
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here during a trip to Vancouver. Booked on a third party website and got a great deal. Check in was pretty efficient, rooms were clean, modern, bright. Comfortabel beds, nice modern bathroom, flat screen TV. Service in teh restaurant for brekafast was tardy and the coffee was average. Overall for teh price I paid, $110 per night, thi swas a great deal in a really convenient location for the sky train/transit

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: maldivesod
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and had very lovely decor in shades of light green and blue which made the room very restful. The bathroom was modern, and towels and toiletries were plentiful -- lovey plush robes. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the best pillows that I have ever experienced. The hotel is located very near to the waterfront walkway...you can walk to Stanley Park in about 20 minutes -- very nice! The hotel was very quiet...I did not hear a sound from the other rooms. The staff were helpful, efficient, and very nice. Free wireless a plus! I would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business, but no real character”
Reviews.Author: flame1982uk
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights in spring, largely because we found such a good rate on-line. The hotel is large, brand new and very professional. Staff were welcoming and friendly and went out of their way to give us restaurant recommendations etc. Rooms were very large and spacious with good facilities. Location was fab - right in downtown Vancouver which made everywhere walkable. Our issue is that it is a corporate business hotel. There was nothing cosy or characterful about it. The beds were comfy and we had a good night's sleep (apart from the noisy housekeeping staff in the morning) but we didn't look forward to going back there and would certainly not have had a night in. Restaurant was average to poor. Great for business travellers though.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel met and exceeded all our needs regarding Handicap Rooms”
Reviews.Author: dlrmjw
Reviews.Content: My husband has very special needs. The hotel met and exceeded all our needs. The Staff from the Bell Staff to the Front Desk asked if they could do anything to make our stay better. The Bathroom had all the features required in a Handicap Washroom and was roomy and easy to manoeuver in.

Reviews.Title: “quality hotel, watch out for the nosey housekeeping staff”
Reviews.Author: latte_fan
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in February 2011. Given the location the hotel offers spectacular views across the water to Grouse Mountain from the floor to ceiling windows in the room. We used the overnight parking and valet service and while it was spendy at $35 per night the service was swift and courteous. Since our stay covered only a Sunday evening we didn't really see other guests in the lobby or using the elevator which added a nice level of privacy to our stay. The reception staff was GREAT, super friendly, answered all our questions about the area and gave us a couple of tips on where to eat diner and breakfast. The only problems we had were both related to the room. First as a couple we we given a room with two queen beds instead of one king -- we thought about going back to reception as asking for a change but the room was so generous in size we just looked at the queen bed as a chance to snuggle closer. The other problem was the house keeping staff. We'd nearly fallen asleep during a later afternoon nap and we're rudely woken up by housekeeping knocking on the door, opening the door, and then stepping into the room. Both of us kept saying "room occupied" "come back later" and after a couple minutes housekeeping stepped back out of the room and closed the door behind them. Ammenties in room we're great, plenty of light, an alarm clock/radio with iPhone docking, generous sized bath tub, great water pressure in the shower, high quality toiletries, coffee/tea/coco maker, free wi-fi, comfortable bed. We never turned the TV on but the room had a wall mounted flat screen that I would guess to be 30+ inches across. Would we stay again? If we found a favorable rate probably.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: yiching
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here over Spring Break with the family and we all really enjoyed the hotel. The rooms are very nice, with a very modern updated look to them and free wifi. The staff is very courteous and go out of their way to be helpful with advice about restaurants and attractions. The location is good but not great. A lot of attractions are somewhat close but I think most people whill still need to cab it, especially if there's a threat of rain. We certainly drove with two little kids in tow. The biggest hit was the outdoor swimming pool and hot tub. I know what you're thinking. Outdoors in Canada in March? Well unlike many hotels, when they say heated pool, they really do mean heated pool! We were very comfortable swimming outdoors in 50F weather. One of my highlights was meeting all the fellow travelers at the hot tub! You just don't get the same atmosphere indoors. The only negative I can think of is the outrageous $37 a day parking fee. Granted, I don't know if it's any better anywhere else downtown but I was taken aback. It was literally about half the cost of my room on hotwire!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!!!”
Reviews.Author: abornilla
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit and was really impressed. From the friendliness of the valet parking all the way to the very welcoming front counter attendant that helped us check in to our room. Will definitely stay here again next time I come back to Vancouver. A special thanks to a Romy Herrera who was more than helpful knowing the fact that this was our first visit in Vancouver and provided us with a lot of helpful tips.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular view with all the luxuries of home!”
Reviews.Author: SportGoofy17
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I had the pleasure of experiencing the NEW Coast Coal Harbour Hotel recently and were extremely pleased with the care and attention we received from the moment we arrived to the Hotel. The staff were friendly and accomodating and the room was beautiful. I requested a high floor when I made the reservation and thankful to receive a room on the 18th floor. HD TV, King Bed, Deep Soaker Relaxed Back Tub, Floor to Ceiling windows with a 180 degree view of Stanley Park, the ocean and mountains. Simply breathtaking. The breakfast in Preston's Restaurant was delicious and checkout time was not until 12 noon! We felt relaxed and spoiled. I would recommend this experience to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “If you can get a good price, well worth staying”
Reviews.Content: Location in downtown very handy - close to Stanley Park and other places of interest. The room was a good size, very clean and modern. I didn't find the beds particularly comfortable - too soft for me. The service was mixed - the concierge was helpful and went out of his way to give us a hand. But the front desk staff were far less amenable. Overall, with the price we got it was a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay! :)”
Reviews.Author: julcool
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were awesome. Made you feel almost at home. From the second you get out of the car at the valet your greeted with a great big smile and it continues from there. They were friendly; without feeling forced or fake which drives me crazy.. lol. Check in was quick and the girl at the front was also friendly of course. Our room was on the 9th floor.. And it was very nice, very clean, bed was super comfy. Went into the hot tub on the first night.. towels are located outside of the change rooms fyi. I was searching haha. We had to ask for directions and the same girl who checked us in was very helpful. And our check-out.. with the same girl btw. was quick and easy too. Parking was a bit pricey.. ended up being 75 dollars for 2 nights :s but we got a good deal on our room so I guess it evens out.. Hotel is in a great location 5 minute walk to Robson street. 7 dollar cab ride to rogers arena.. We would stay here again! I hope other visitors get the same treatment and experience that we did.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: noniew
Reviews.Content: Exfcellent hotel, wonderful staff, comfortable beds, great location and most of all great value for money. Stayed for 10 noghts and would definitley recommend it. Would book again

Reviews.Title: “Courteous Staff and Comfortable Bed & Room”
Reviews.Author: Vancouver_Islander_8
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in this hotel and enjoyed the very comfortable bed, excellent shower, flat-screen tv, and free wireless Internet. I changed to this hotel when I learned another across the street would charge me nearly $20/day for Internet access in my room. Staff were kind, i.e. offering me an umbrella for the evening. Housekeeping staff respected my need for a nap and didn't pressure me to let them in the room one day, when all I needed was more coffee, which she graciously and quickly brought me so I could get on with my nap. I would stay here again, if on business, as the rate was good. Convenient location, with liquor store and Shopper's Drug Mart within one block.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding from check-in to check-out!”
Reviews.Author: heidisrestaurant
Reviews.Content: From the moment I was greeted, to the time I checked out 5 days later, my stay was impeccable. The staff were friendly, professional and attentive. The room was clean, spacious, and tastefully appointed with a fantastic view of the mountains, ocean and city lights! And most importantly, great beds! The hotel itself is so central, I was able to walk everywhere in the downtown core and was only minutes from the transit stations. My stay was extremely enjoyable and I will certainly stay there again when I am back in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, easy access to harbour.”
Reviews.Author: dontmakemerun
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure when I saw the side road entrance. Inside is a nice clean hotel. You should stay there. Staff pleasant, maintenance great even if I did lock myself out of the safe. Very short walk to the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Coal Harbour !”
Reviews.Author: Yqrtravel
Reviews.Content: Great rate, great location. Will stay here again next year !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: airmilesali
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel as part of a 6 week visit to Canada on business. The customer service at check in was excellent, I was upgraded to a waterfront corner room, clean, spacious, FREE WI FI. If I had a query the reception staff could not be more helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a room and area to work. The only down side is they do not have a hotel bar, but the location allows you to visit many amenities locally and the doormen watched me push a trolley with 4 large bags to the taxi without offering help, but hey ho. I have never given a hotel 5 out of 5 in all categories. That should say it all.

Reviews.Title: “Two Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: lariat350
Reviews.Content: Reserved a basic room which was small but very clean and nicely appointed, however the heating/cooling system made so much noise cycling on and off that we were constantly woke up during the night. I complained the next morning and was moved from the 11th floor to the 18th floor to a much larger larger room which was a very nice upgrade!. I found the employees to be very friendly and the hotel is nicely located for seawall access, one caveat...undergroud parking was $37/day taxes in !!!. You can thank city of Vancouver and their 21% parking tax for that!!.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Travels98
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this Hotel! Great location for shopping, sightseeing, and for going to the theatre or concerts. The rooms are great, modern, very comfortable, quiet and so clean. The staff are wonderful, friendly, welcoming and helpful. The area is very safe and walking at night was fine.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel with the modern feel”
Reviews.Author: VancouverCraig
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new with a modern style. The colours in the rooms are cool and not that inviting but the bed is very comfortable. A small size LCD tv in the room and a safe on the floor of the closet, you have to get down on your knees to open and look into the safe it is floor level without lighting. Staff were professional at check in and out. Typical expensive downtown parking but that is expected (valet was very good). The room was very quite

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: snorklemom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night after our week in Whistler. We had tickets to the Canucks-Oilers game so it was a quick stay. From the minute we checked in at the front desk, we noticed how attentive and helpful everyone was. We asked a lot of questions... we wanted sushi for a late lunch on Boxing Day and so many were closed. Ron actually googled some places and found one open and brought us a map so we could find it. Tsunami Sushi... excellent and fun (review) and the kids ordered room service which he personally delivered. We asked about walking to Rogers for the game and he told us how to do it safely. It was sunset and the Christmas lights were gorgeous! The room was so comfortable for the 4 of us. We had a corner room with a harbour view (floor to ceiling windows) at a great internet rate. Coffee/tea maker, free wi-fi, room service and valet parking (kind of high, $35) but a fantastic location. We walked to Robson St. for sushi and shopping AND the waterfront to see the seaplanes landing. But the best part was the friendly and helpful staff. Thanks Ron for the recommendations and everyone at the front desk for directions!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and good location for the City centre”
Reviews.Author: Jhus63
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely new hotel. The rooms were large enough but not what you would call spacious.

Reviews.Title: “What else could you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: ramblerCampbellRiver
Reviews.Content: My daughter, grand daughter and myselft stayed one night at this central, quiet, efficient and very pleasant hotel. The valet parking was the icing on the cake especially in a busy town. View from the 14 floor overlooked the city, Stanley Park with the snow capped mountains in the background. Staff were courteous and extremely friendly. The outside pool and out tub was a treat and we look forward to staying there again. Anne Stubbs, Campbell River, B.C.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, fun, bright and easy”
Reviews.Author: Elietha
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with my mother and nephew and this hotel worked great for us. We had enough space, slept great, used the pool and received great service. I would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and modern, excellent service and beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: smtong77
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a wonderful experience at this new, classy hotel. It was conveniently located within walking distance to both downtown and the waterfront, with an amazing view of Stanley Park and the water. The professional staff were very helpful and friendly, and the room was clean, spacious and luxiourious, with comfortable linens and bedding as well as with modern decor. We would definitely stay at the Coast Coal Harbour again!

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly and Close to Everything! Best Hotel in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: mang_tomas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with my wife and infant daugther. Room was HUGE and had a fantastic, panoramic view of Coal Harbour and Stanley Park. This hotel is close to everything! We even went for a walk on the famed Stanley Park Seawall (just outside the lobby doors) and visited the Olympic Cauldron (only a block away). We will definitely stay here again the next time we go to Vancouver. Staff were excellent. Room service was excellent and the prices are inexpensive. Wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean! With an abundance of TOWELS!!”
Reviews.Author: caitee
Reviews.Content: After staying in a nice, but not particularly clean hotel in Whistler, walking into this hotel was a breathe of fresh air. The service was friendly, we got a handsome young man who happened to be on his first day on the job. We thought he was a gem, but he forgot to tell us country folk(not really from the country) how to properly use the elevator. Turned out to be a hilarious story that I will never forget, so thank you that. The room was super clean and the bathroom was spotless. There was a recycling bin and green bin (which we totally used!!) Checking in and out was super easy and I appreciated the times for both. The location was nice, we walked everywhere being "poor" college students. We had a view of an office building, but we didn't spend much time in the hotel so that was okay. I tried dancing and communicating with the people working. They didn't pay any attention to me :(

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT stay - great room, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: PaulTheTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: Well done. This hotel is a great location, and I just love the rooms. Floor to ceiling windows make it a bright, airy room (although its not the largest of rooms). Very clean, very nice. Polite and accommodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: welshcakes1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a 3 night extension to my tour of the NW Pacific Coast of the US. It was the best hotel of the entire trip, ideally placed for visiting Vancouver and its highlights, including Vancouver Island. I would not hesitate to recommend it, charming and helpful staff, good value, spotlessly clean and a spacious, modern bedroom and en suite bathroom. I ate (late on the evening of arrival) in the restaurant and the food was delicious. Highly recommended overall.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tdot_to_Van0924
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend treated me to a weekend at this hotel and it was unbelievable! The service was spectacular. He had pre-arranged some things for me with the hotel prior to our visit and it was all executed beautifully by the hotel staff. The rooms were clean, modern, fresh and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Ho hum”
Reviews.Author: emcgoo
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Vancouver for business. Although I normally stay with family or friends, I thought it would be a treat to get some time to myself and booked a hotel room. The new Coast Coal Harbor got great reviews and the prices were really good so I booked it. Throughout my stay, the service was stellar. The foyer/reception is a little ho-hum. There is a lot of plastic masquerading as wood. The room I was given was entirely underwhelming. It felt like a cross between a motel and a hospital. Very cramped, plastic/industrial feeling, no view. I guess this is why it is so affordable. Had I been there strictly on business and not seeking a mini-escape, it would have been adequate. Ultimately I decided to pay for an upgrade and for an additional $40, got a room that was much better (more room, lovely view, etc). All in all, it was…. fine. But you can get better deals on nice hotels in Vancouver. Throughout all of this, the service was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location, beautiful stay.”
Reviews.Author: EP1285
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Coast Coal Harbour Hotel twice and have been completely impressed both times. The location and the rooms are fantastic, but the most notable feature of the hotel is the excellent service. From the moment you pull up the car, every person on the staff is almost superhumanly friendly, welcoming, and helpful. For example: during our visit in September, we booked two rooms because we had a family member that was supposed to be joining us. The family member cancelled her plans, and we were stuck with two rooms. We figured that the money would just be lost, but instead, the man at the front desk upgraded our room to a beautiful suite with a balcony and threw in our parking for free. Great moments like that will have us coming back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff - great stay”
Reviews.Author: rsot
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Coast Coal Harbour Hotel for a conference and was very impressed with the staff there. All of the needs of the attendees were looked after quickly and efficiently and the conference room was bright and welcoming. My room did look directly into an office building (workers still there) but the room itself was very clean and comfortable. I would especially like to thank Jeremiah at the front desk. He was extremely friendly, gregarious, and efficient as he accomplished everything quickly. Enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at right price”
Reviews.Author: westozman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Coast Coal for 4 nights before catching a cruise ship 1st week of Sept 2010. Booked hotel before it was opened so got a great rate on the internet. Hotel is obviously new so is clean with modern fit out and very comfortable. Room was just a standard room but was large and spacious. As for location, it was ideal for us as we could walk to the Canada Place to board a cruise ship. Its also handy for the harbour, float planes and walking the sea wall. Vancouver is a very walkable city. We walked to Granville Island from the Coast Coal. The Hotel is a few blocks out of main shopping area but was not a problem. Did not eat at the hotel as we found the Elephant and Castle a couple of blocks away was excellent. Loved the free internet in the business centre. All in all a good hotel. Would def stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SussexCanuck
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Coast Coal Harbour before embarking on an Alaska cruise. Unfortunately, we had already booked 3 nights at one of the big business hotels in Vancouver after the cruise - I would have preferred to spend them here. We had a double room and a kingsize room, and both were well decorated, furnished and spacious. Our king room had a view overlooking the harbout which was very nice. But the best thing for me about the Coast Coal Harbour is it's location. Coal harbour, the waterfront and marina, is a very nice place. This hotel is only a short walk from the hustle and bustle of downtown, but without all the noise and traffic. It is also ideally situated for walking to Stanley Park. Having stayed in a number of downtown Vancouver hotels, I will definitely be going back to the Coast Coal Harbour next time.

Reviews.Title: “Best female friendly hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: Kukana96789
Reviews.Content: Coast Coal Hotel has an excellent location for business as well as an extremely helpful staff. I arrived earlier than the normal checkin time, but within 15 minutes I had received my room which was a plus as I had flown overnight from Hawaii. Room itself was very comfortable with all the necessities I needed to use the room as a base for my work. Desk had an excellent location by the window and the complimentary internet worked very well. Ammenities in the bathroom were the best I have seen and I travel every month for business. The large pump bottles of lotion and bath soap were a welcome change. The beds where very comfortable. Bathrobes nice touch and large bath towels. Mahalo to the entire hotel staff. The restaurant in the same building was good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ChurchgateDevon
Reviews.Content: Easy access to city attractions and waterfront. City explorer bus stops just along the road giving access to Stanley Park, Granville Island and Gastown which are all worth visiting. The restaurant was fairly small and, on our first night, was extremely noisy. It was also expensive with a fairly small range of meals. Plenty of places to eat out nearby and a 7/11 convenience store on the corner of the block and a very nice coffee shop opposite. Be warned there are some maps around that show the hotel in the wrong location which can make it difficult to find your way back to it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a Very Central Area”
Reviews.Author: gwilliams
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights on business - very comfortable room, good amenities, and breakfast was excellent. Centrally located for both business and tourism - and a really good deal at $129 a night.Had a corner room with some glimpses of the mountains and the harbour, with lots of room, free wireless internet (there should be a law about this - all hotels should have to provide it), good towels, and a stated environmental policy that goes above and beyond most (green bins in the room)

Reviews.Title: “crisp, convienient and curtious”
Reviews.Author: lancastrianbrit
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Had deluxe king corner room on 20th room. Very spacious with sitting area which had lounge chair, marble topped coffee table and sette ( pullout bed?) very large desk seperated it from bed area but no fridge :( two wardrobes and lamps a go-go. It had a view as such but due to building work ( can't really avoid it in Vancouver) was disappearing fast and could see Stanley Park and harbour if you pressed your nose up against window and looked out the other side as room as had full length windows on two sides. However mostly could see into offices directly opposite,good job room had net curtains. Unfortunately for me housekeeper had a habit of pulling them right back and one day I returned to the room stripped off and well you can imagine it was a bit embarassing. Turn down service was a bit hit and miss.First night nothing, second water and chocolates,third night water only !!! Other wise other positive reviewers are spot on reagrding rooms,decor, recyling, green issues,helpfulness of staff,et all.I agree with them all Can't comment on Prestons as did not use but prices did not seem much different to any other resturant of that style serving that type of food in Vancouver. Overall l one of the best hotel experiences i have had and honestly that says a lot about this hotel. Stay there and find out for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: brucepoppey
Reviews.Content: friendly staff, hotel was new so really lovely, restaurant pricey, Vancouver a pricey place, but easy to get about on foot. Hotel in great location as a 7 eleven next door for goodies and coffee and opposite a great place for breakfast, vancouver style, coffee and muffins

Reviews.Title: “Nice, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: meldrob
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely, clean, good linens and a great location, just a block from the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: claretcats
Reviews.Content: This was our last hotel on a trip to Canada that started in Montreal. It was the perfect hotel to end our trip in. The room were spacious and clean. Recycling bins should be in every hotel, a good bit of forward thinking. The bathrobe was a bonus. The staff,especially the bar staff, were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Breakfast in Prestons was very good although it is slightly expensive and there are several places in the area serving breakfast. A pleasant stroll takes you to Gastown and Chinatown. Avoid Chinatown at night unless you are visiting a restaurant,in which case use a taxi. There are lots of beggars in Gastown but a firm NO is all you need. Make sure to visit the steam clock. It's not far over to Grouse mountain and the Capilano Suspension bridge. Also well worth a visit but not for the faint-hearted especially if you get caught in a thunderstorm as we did. As others have said Stanley park is close by. There is a good grocery store on the corner with fantastic displays of fruit and vegetables well worth a photo according to our tour guide. I would recommend this hotel and if I ever go to Canada again would hope to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DBLT2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights, hotel is in a great location with very stylish rooms. Four of us (2 adults + 2 teens) shared one room. Not enough drinks etc. but one quick call to reception produced an abundance of extra supplies. Very helpful reception, easy to leave bags for the day once booked out. Fantastic public access toilet within hotel! Found Vancouver a bit dull and too soulless, however beggars are everywhere and are a real pain! Walk up the road to Robson Street and find the Crepe shop for the best breakfast going, superb!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Decor”
Reviews.Author: klausinkent
Reviews.Content: Loved the decor! The room was well-decorated with modern furnishings, nice tilework in the bathroom, and a lovely grey color scheme with green and white accents. Travelled with our two teenage daughters who slept comfortably on the full-sized hide-a-bed in the sitting room. The room was generously-sized with a sitting room, bedroom, and bathroom and two flat-screen TVs. The bathroom had a full-sized tub with a separate shower. The small pool is outdoors, but heated and there is a hot tub. My favorite feature about this hotel is that it obviously takes caring for the environment seriuosly. The toiletries came in large dispensers (although small bottles were availabe for you to take home), they had a recycling bin, and a composting bin. Yes, a composting bin in the room! First time I have ever seen this anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, modern, and pet friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Chuckabadger
Reviews.Content: The hotel was modern and had the attributes I normally see in boutique hotels. The rooms were spacious and had modern amenities making us feel like we had a small studio apartment in Vancouver. We also traveled with our dog (Border Collie) and the hotel was very accommodating of pet owners. A park one block away meant that potty breaks were easily accommodated. The parking was quite expensive at $47/night. We should have parked on the street for free. There were many open spots available. Location was very good, one block away from the harbor and seaplane base. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a deal! Fancy hotel right by the water!”
Reviews.Author: kcwildcat35
Reviews.Content: We could not believe when we walked up to our hotel. We paid $125US a night, and it probably could have been double. Our room looked brand new, comfy beds, super modern and sleek design. There is also a pool/hot tub/gym. It is a close walk to the water, about 2 streets over. But it isn't really in the heart of any certain "area," so you need to do some walking, and the buses in VC aren't very helpful when wanting to take a short trip. The only complaint we had was the air conditioning, which when turned on you could barely hear each other talk.

Reviews.Title: “What a find! Elegant,modern,eco friendly hotel in great location downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Cruisenana
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night, hubby and I and our 5yr old granddaughter. 1. Location - downtown Vancouver- 1 block to waterfront promenade 5 blocks to trendy shopping area- Robson Street 8 blocks to entrance Stanley Park near Cruise Ship terminal 2..Getting there - Hotel is easy reach from Canada Line which comes from the airport, get off at the end of the line- Waterfront station, then 10 min walk to hotel. Also 10min walk from Cruise Ship terminal at Canada Place. These walks are on a scenic promenade along the waterfront. Avoid driving there if poss.-Parking is expensive - almost $40 incl.tax daily, 3.Hotel - fairly new, fast elevators, eco friendly - refillable soap dispensers etc in bathroom, bins for recycling in room etc. We stayed in lovely Superior rm - spacious corner rm, floor to ceiling glass windows,king bed, 2 comfy chairs with ottomans, wall mounted TV, coffee maker, iron, ironing board, bathrobes. Lots of views out those windows! And everything spotless! Pool and spa are off gym - small, nowhere to sit around pool area- only for swimming, not sunbathing. 4. Food - Restaurant in Hotel- Prestons- good but expensive. Lots of restaurants within walking distance- along waterfront, up on Robson street. We ate at White Spot- 10min walk.. 5. What to do nearby - Stanley Park ( if adventurous can walk waterfront promenade which links up with Stanley Park seawall for hours of scenic walking/running) Promenade-sit on a bench and watch continuous harbour activity-cruise ships bound for Alaska, float planes, commuter seabus, private yachts etc. Water splash Park for young children - 1 block

Reviews.Title: “New property, large spacious room, great view but not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: mlsLincoln_MA
Reviews.Content: the hotel , location and staff are all very good. the lobby is a little sparse. The bathrooms are a little small and plain. we had a large corner room on teh 17th floor. i would reccomend the corner rooms. They have great windows and a very good view of the harbor. The location is excellent and is great for walking to shops, restaurants and the waterfront. The pool is quite small . The 37 parking charge seemed steep but maybe that is the going rate. I would rate this 3.5 if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: 2FromTrona
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights recently. Rate was their "wedding special" - show a wedding invitation and it gets you a great rate. Room was on the 15th floor with great views from floor to ceiling windows. Location of the hotel is very convenient, on a quiet street near the water and within easy walking distance of both Gastown and Stanley Park. Service was very good (great job Nicci - you're cut out to excel in the hospitality industry). Only minor negatives, the room was a little small, no fridge and the A/C was quite loud. Overall this is a great value for money choice in an expensive city. Also had a very good meal at Preston's.

Reviews.Title: “Love our stay here.”
Reviews.Author: SouthAussieDave
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights after booking a great discount rate through the hotel. We chatted nicely with the reception staff and (cheekily) asked if we could get the nicest room possible even though we had got such a cheap rate already. We were very pleasantly surprised when we got a high floor with a great view of the harbour. As others have said the location is great. Easy walk up to Robson street and even easier to get on to the 'hop on-hop off' bus which is a great way to get around the city. A block or two from the waterfront which is a definite for a stroll along. Staff are super friendly, rooms (as expected) are modern, clean and fresh. For the price we paid we got a real bargain in a very pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver made easy by the wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: miffles
Reviews.Content: Prior to even arriving at this hotel I was impressed. I had a need to contact the front desk on a couple of occassions to co ordinate a few things. I received great advice and 100% assistance from the reception staff. The hotel was surprisingly easy to find.....for an out of towner. The position is excellent, just a couple of blocks back from Canada Place. An excellent place to stay prior to heading out on an Alaskan cruise......very close to the ports. The light rail system is easy to access from the hotel...just a very short distance. My husband arrived from the airport using the Canada line and i drove in on Hwy 1/ Hastings Street. Neither of us had any difficulties. The staff looking after the cars/valet parking are all delightfully helpful and super efficient. Their local roads and traffic knowledged was spot on...While at the hotel we ventured off in many directions and each time was given extra tips by the lads taking care of the vehicles. We stayed at the hotel on two occassions...pre and post cruise. We experienced both the comfort room and the superior room. Both room types are well appointed with plenty of room space. Great bathrooms with everything we needed available. The hotel rooms were both very quiet. We didnt ever hear any other outside noises. We enjoyed our breakfast at the hotel's restaurant.....but didnt have every breakfast there as the hotel is situated in an area where there are many eateries and interesting cafes to explore. I was impressed most of all with the staff. This hotel must being doing something very right to have so many happy helpful staff ....all the time. Well done Coast Coal Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “One of our faves!”
Reviews.Author: paulajean68
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent one night (though I wish it had been more) at the Coast Coal Harbour and, having experienced many hotels on our 2-week west coast vacation - all of them very nice in various ways - this was our favourite. We had king room on the top floor with a gorgeous view of the harbour. The room was spacious, very well appointed and the bed was a dream. The staff was super friendly, happy and helpful (thanks Jeremiah!). Some of the things that put this stay at the top of the list: - Eco-consciousness (recycling AND compost bins, low-flow toilets, large pump-action containers of body wash, shampoo, etc. ~ we didn't have to waste the small travel containers which are also provided) - Reliable free wireless internet connection - A fantastic gym facility, complete with locker room and lockers, which lead out to the pool and whirlpool. You don't have to go back up to your room to change into your swim suit and take a dip after your workout. Really loved the convenience of this! - Speedy elevators! Even though we were on the top floor, we never waited more than a few seconds for one. - Noon checkout. It was nice to not feel rushed (made us feel like we got an extra day) without having to ask for a late checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: coleenleblanc
Reviews.Content: If you are making a trip to Vancouver try the Coast Coal Harbour Hotel . It is a new place and between the excellent service and the spectaculor rooms, you will not be disappointed.
