They have taken the extra step in making your stay perfect. We were down the the Eagles concert and I made a mistake on the date of the concert. The front desk went out of their way to try and change my tickets. We ended up keeping our tickets and stayed 2 days..... What a treat it was.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel close to the harbor.”
Reviews.Author: IowaTraveler22
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in the hotel over Canda Day. We had a room on the 15th floor with a harbor view. The view is spectacular. The staff was very helpful and provided maps to help us find out way around the downtown area. Late at night Preston's was pretty loud and packed (of course it was Canada Day).

Reviews.Title: “Best value for quality provided in downtown Vancouver - Plain and simple”
Reviews.Author: CdnWT
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, as the title suggests, this is the best value you'll find in downtown Vancouver in the 3-4 star hotel range. Granted it is still a brand new hotel and chances are, the rates will go up, but for now, it's become my hotel of choice in the city. I'm fairly loyal to Hilton brands, but unfortunately, the only downtown option in Vancouver is the Hampton Inn which half the time, is sold out or just poor value for money and its location is less desirable than the Coast Coal Harbour, if not attending a show in town. That said, this hotel is good enough that you could put a Hilton sign on the door tomorrow morning without changing anything and no one would notice it used to be a Coast Hotel. That's how nice it is. PROS include: -Extremely nice staff, minus one exception on my second stay in June which I brushed off. That particular staff member should not be in the service business. -The food at Preston's is excellent, I had breakfast one morning, lunch another day and I liked it so much, I ordered room service on my following stay. Room service is remarkably reasonably priced. -CLEAN rooms with beds fit for any princess. Like sleeping on a cloud. I just wished 1)they had feather pillows instead of foam, 2) Had more than 2 pillows on a double bed. Most hotels will give you 3 or 4 these days but that's a very minor detail. -Nice pool area with a HOT hot tub, which is always a plus over some lukewarm hotel hot tubs I've seen. Didn't use the gym here but it is equipped well enough for any workout routine. Note to management: first time I've seen a hotel gym closed at night and not opened 24 hours. -All rooms already come with wine glasses, regular glasses, bottle opener, elastics, paper clips and large sized toileteries bottles. Has mentioned in previous reviews, lots of little environmentally conscious touches here. I just wished all hotels had rooms this well-equipped with things you actually need. Also, I didn't find the A/C as noisy as a lot of reviews pointed out. Free WiFi in rooms, works with iPhone and it's FAST. A real blessing and comes with the added benefit of not feeling nickel and dimed for everything. Deep-soaking tubs are another added bonus you will find here that a lot of upscale chain hotels don't have (including the Marriott Pinnacle next door, which I've also stayed at, and where you will pay a room rate in excess of 100$ more a night). Windows in the rooms open for fresh air, loved that. iHome clock radio in all rooms also, so you can bring your iPod or iPhone along and listen to your favorite tunes. CONS: -You have to be nitpicking to find anything bad here but I have to say, on upper floors, you will hear faint noises from the elevators. That's surprising given the rooms seem otherwise well-insulated, since I never heard my neighbors (rooms had the DND signs hung so they were definately occupied) and hallway noise isn't particularly loud. -Business centre is closed on weekends, so you have to use the front desk's computers, and there's always this feeling when doing so that you have to be quick since I felt I was intruding on the staff's working area. Otherwise, a solid hotel in downtown Vancouver. This loyal Hilton fan tells you to book it without hesitation, enjoy Vancouver, and I will certainly give other Coast Hotels in city centres a try should the need arise.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly beds, understated elegant decor, modern, green.”
Reviews.Author: 50-ish-ers
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 2 different occasions. Our request for rooms with a view of the harbour were honored. Helpful staff. Secure elevators. Excellent location, as others have stated. Gym looked good. Pool and hot tub are outdoors, surrounded by tall buildings, very basic but all we needed. Quick check-in, check-out. Spacious quiet rooms. Good WiFi. Coffee/tea/cocoa supplies handy in room. Interior-lit safe was nice, except I wish it wasn't on the floor. Emphasis on recycling, and reduced energy/ water usage. We'd certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation and service!”
Reviews.Author: KFMVancouver
Reviews.Content: From the minute I arrived at the hotel I was offered excellent customer service within the Coast Coal Harbour's clean, modern and relaxing environment. The new hotel has done an excellent job of building a climate of professionalism, functionality and intuitive service - all the while ensuring sustainable practices are in place. The Coast truly achieves 'service with a smile'; I really didn't come across any staff members that weren't smiling and incredibly pleasant to converse with. And the food! Hotel food is often mediocre at best, but Prestrons Restaurant Chef Allessandro Vianello's dishes are fresh, interesting, flavourful, and well presented. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone booking for business or pleasure. - Karran Finlay Marketing, 2010

Reviews.Title: “Superb beyond our expectations”
Reviews.Author: KMadden_10
Reviews.Content: Coast Coal Harbour is to be commended for their impressive service in every category. Liaising with their professional and knowledgeable staff to coordinate our association's needs was easy and efficient. The rooms were attractive and fresh, clean and relaxing and the food was remarkable - certainly not your typical hotel fare - nothing but praise to the chef. I appreciated the prompt and friendly efforts the staff went to attend to our last minute requests; they understand the importance of quality customer service and attention to the finest details. I compliment the Coast Coal Harbour and Thank you. - Very Impressive ISES Vancouver K Madden, President

Reviews.Title: “All Around Excellent”
Reviews.Author: SLJProductions
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Coast for a weekend board retreat and they treated us like superstars. So impressed with the service, all the smiles and the beautiful hotel. Food was amazing in the meetings and in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Beds perfect, rooms good, staff needs training”
Reviews.Author: CeePeeGee
Reviews.Content: Beds and rooms are good, and that is the only positive I can say about this hotel. Most staff-members had apparently no idea that they were there for the guests, and not the other way around. Breakfast is poor and way too expensive, 8 CAD for tea of coffee, half a strawberry, 3 small ( 1 by 3 inches ) slices of melon, one croissant and one item that vaguely reminded me of a muffin, plate-served. No decent lobby. Certainly NOT staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cant' fault it!”
Reviews.Author: ClaraM
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights at the end of May and could not fault anything. The staff were all friendly, pleasant and helpful. The room was spacious, beds comfortable and bathroom well laid out. Everywhere is clean and well kept. We ate the first night at the bar and enjoyed the food so much we ate in their restaurant on the second night. The food was well presented and flavoursome and the service excellent. The hotel is in a good area and within walking distance of most things. We would recommend this hotel and would stay there again should we go back to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “A highly recommended hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dave2011
Reviews.Content: This was the nicest hotel experience that I've had in a long time. It will be my preferred hotel in downtown Vancouver from now on. Rooms: exceptionally fresh with very modern decor. Staff: exceptionally friendly and helpful. Wireless Internet: free and fast Location: Outstanding - close to every place one wants to be in downtown Vancouver The only minor issue is the valet parking; the staff is friendly and helpful but the cost is a bit steep. On the other hand, the majority of travellers will arrive by air, I'm sure. The parking is a non-issue for them.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: pman94
Reviews.Content: 2 weeks and about 5 different hotels later we arrived at the Coast Coal Harbour and were in love from the first minute we walked in. Great convenient location, great helpful friendly staff and what a view. Nice to have an oversize soaking tub too. Gym equpment is top notch. Prestons is a little pricey but otherwise this was the best hotel of our two weeks away. Very comfortable beds, oversize room with sitting area and did I mention the views???? I would reccomend this hotel to anyone without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dafbird
Reviews.Content: We really loved this hotel. Staff were very friendly. The view from the 17th floor was amazing. We loved the outdoor pool. The rooms were lovely & quiet. The beds were so comfy. It was within walking distance of a lot of things like Stanley Park & the Lookout. It was very easy to get to from the airport. Get the skytrain all the way in the Granville Station & it's about 10 minutes walk from there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel close to the Vancouver Convention Centre”
Reviews.Author: Soonie68
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight to attend a conference. I wished I had arrived earlier or had a longer stay. This is a beautiful hotel with very comfortable rooms. I had a view of the harbour. The beds were comfortable and it was very quiet. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel For Canada Place Event”
Reviews.Author: DetailsByBill
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated about three blocks from the convention center. There are a number of shops and restaurants within a few blocks of the hotel and a 7-11 two blocks away. The hotel is comfortable and friendly. Rooms are a bit small but adequate. A restaurant/bar (Prestons) a trendy spot on the ground floor is the only food service within the hotel. The service at Prestons was good but with a limited menu for dinner and breakfast. The dinner choices were limited but the food was good but a bit pricey. Breakfast buffet was typical breads, fruit and pastries at $17 per person. I'd stay here again when I needed a room near the harbor or convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaGirl99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights while in Vancouver for work. Had room 701 - which though not on a high floor has a peek-a-boo water and mountain view through the two buildings across the street. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and decorated beautifully. Enough room to do some stretching on the floor even! Having stayed in several of the hotels in downtown Vancouver, I found the room more spacious than any of the others. The bathroom is a generous size too. Extremely clean, well appointed and obviously 'green' conscious with recycling, organic waste and larger dispensers for the soap etc. (though the little ones are also available, you don't feel as guilty for opening a little one and throwing it away for one little use). The desk was comfortable to work at - as was the swivel, rocking executive chair. Downside was that the flat-screen tv was a bit small and it wasn't moveable (permanently fixed to the wall, would have been nicer to be swivel or something). Also, the air conditioning is curiously loud - I'd read that in other reviews and was amused to find myself agreeing. I turned it off since it wasn't too hot or cold. A bonus was the free wifi internet and the in-room coffee maker with torrefazione coffee and actual creamer (instead of powder). Also, lots of glasses (highballs, wine glasses and water glasses - 6 in total!) and a wine bottle opener - all very handy! Detractors were that the pool and hot tub are outdoors (which seems kind of dumb to me for Vancouver which doesn't get fantastic outdoor weather). Not only are they outdoors, but they're looked down upon by several floors of the office buildings that surround it - there is no privacy really at all. Maybe after the work hours, but I was considering it around 4pm when there were plenty of people still in their office. (I think the hotel should consider a gazebo around the hot tub or something). So instead of a soak in the hot tub, I opted for a workout. Nice gym, well appointed. The other big detractor is that the parking is valet only. It's not a bad price for Vancouver ($28/night) but I like to have the option to self park, and there isn't one with this hotel. It wasn't too bad on Wed morning, about a 7-10 min wait for my car, but I think i hit it at the right time and was leaving a little later. On the Thursday morning though, there was only one valet attendant and he was run off his feet with people arriving and leaving. It took 25 mins to get my car and I was 15 mins late for my meeting. So that was kind of annoying - the valet company needs to look at its staffing levels! The restaurant is expensive - not really worth it. $8 for oatmeal seems a bit ridiculous to me as is $14 for the standard eggs, bacon, hashbrowns and toast. Other than that, the staff were all friendly, check-in was quick (though check-out was a bit slow with only 2 staff on and one stuck on the phone - we were lined up for several minutes). The hotel is well situated in Coal Harbour - it's a quiet, safe part of Vancouver. There aren't a huge number of restaurants in the 1-block radius, but they're not more than a few blocks walk. There are some handy places though very nearby - a 7-eleven in the same block, a Shoppers Drug Mart across the street, and an Urban Fare grocery store with lots of ready-to-eat take away food. Overall, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city hotel”
Reviews.Author: AbbeyD
Reviews.Content: This is a really lovely hotel in a good location only a block from the waterfront, within easy walking distance of Robson Street and Canada Place, and with access to Stanley Park for good measure. We had a beautiful spacious room, on the corner, with great city views at night. Although the hotel was full as far as we could tell, it was always very quiet and tranquil. Staff were always helpful and took time to answer any queries. We ate very well one night in the restaurant. Perhaps the only quibble is that, because the restaurant is physically so separate, there is nowhere really in the public areas just to have a coffee or a quiet drink.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Padma2007
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of this new hotel. Perfect for coming in from the airport on the Canada Line, taking the sky train across town, walking to Stanley Park, the waterfront, and Robson street, and finally, hopping on the bus to Horseshoe Bay to catch the ferry to Vancouver Island. Had a really nice meal at the hotel restaurant, and also appreciated the proximity to Urban Fare across the street for lunch and picnic supplies. The room was modern and very comfortable, and the staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “poor customer service, please read the whole review, won't return”
Reviews.Author: PMSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coast Coal upon reading good reviews and as it is a new hotel. After a long flight from Australia, we were looking for a smooth check in and rest. The girl at the check in did not speak clear English, and did not seem confident of the procedures to check in. It took a while. She also did not activate our room keys, so when we got to our rooms, we could not get in. The bell boy had to go down, and we had to wait before this was resolved. Not a good first impression. The girl also had asked us if we wanted the newspapers( at a fee) or not. We had said no, and we also WROTE it down on the check in form. In the morning we found newspapers had been delivered to our rooms. We found having to chase up on these issues annoying as they should not be an issue. But the final cut was when we asked for an adapter as my husband requires a special machine to help him breathe during sleep. We were told that there were no adapters and none can be arranged. The reason we were given was that adapters were not returned and the hotel has now adopted the policy of not providing any adapters. We have never had this experience before. International hotels provide the adapters for use and if it goes missing then it is billed to the room account. This is standard practice as far as we know. When my husband told the staff this and offered to pay if the adapter is not returned, he was told that it was his issue, and to get it himself. If I may add the tone and manner in which this was said was rude and unacceptable. On the feedback form for the hotel there is NO section on how they can improve their facilities , services etc...so basically no section for you to write any criticisms!!! I found this laughable and ridiculous. The room air conditioner was very loud. On a positive note the beds were comfortable and clean, the bathroom was adequate. There is no separate hair conditioner provided. The only staff that smiled at us when we left was the tall blond gentleman who helped us load the luggage into the taxi. He was very helpful. I believe there are probably too few good staff at this hotel and the rest are inadequate and incompetent, and either lacking training or brains. Yes you could say that I am angry because we did not get good sleep or rest and this affected our stay and enjoyment of the city. Good luck to you to meet the few good staff or if you do not need help with anything and know the city well etc.. As for us we would not be returning, because as a brand new hotel they really do have a great competitive advantage in attracting guests but not if they get this sort of terrible unacceptable service.

Reviews.Title: “SO SO”
Reviews.Author: ogopogie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so so. The heating/air conditioning was so loud it kept waking us up every time it turned on. This surprised us considering it is a new hotel. Do not like the fact that the parking is $28/day and Valet only. However the staff seemed friendly and very helpful. Check in was a breeze. The food at the hotel restaurant was also so so. Prices to be expected for down town Vancouver. I was disappointed in the amenities in the room. It was boring and plain. The price was right for an into rate of $129/night. On the upside I would say that I was treated well in the sense that I was given a complementary upgrade and had a wonderful view from my room (while my vision lasted). I was there to get laser eye surgery and it is right across the street from the clinic so it was really handy.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: Lynds144
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay! Perfect location, great room, amazing bathroom and beds. Would recommend to anyone. Also wish would be to have the pool open past 7:30pm

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Babs073
Reviews.Content: Jeremiah at reception is amazing at his job! He immediately made us feel welcomed to the hotel. The hotel is new, clean and quiet. It has a beautiful gym, a small swimming pool and a hot tub. It is located approx 4 blocks to a very large mall. The building is surrounded by large buildings, but it is very modern and very "city". Again, Jeremiah is lovely, and took very good care of us due to the fact there was a storm and we needed to come back to the hotel and stay another night. Not only did he greet us with a big beautiful smile, but we left feeling very happy we stayed there. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff. Great Location. Great View. Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: ManOnTheMove
Reviews.Content: My 3 day stay was close to perfect. I felt very welcome instantly. My 15th floor room has an awesome view of Coal Harbour and the Sea Planes! If I was not in such a beautiful city, I would not have left the room! Oh, did I mention the hot tub and pool outside on the fifth level?! AND a fitness center that was almost a small gym! My bed was the ultimate in comfort. Another HUGE bonus...FREE LOCAL PHONE CALLS AND WIRELESS!!! Hello...can you say GENEROUS?! I am already planning my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for discount rate - for business trips”
Reviews.Author: nkt134
Reviews.Content: I stayed almost a week at the Coast Coal Harbour hotel as I was participating to an exhibition in the nearby exhibition centre. The hotel is really good for business purposes, providing you get a discount rate. Location is perfect, only 5 minutes walk from the fair and our contacts' offices. The hotel is new, staff very (too ?) friendly, however I would find the whole place a bit too impersonal for leisure stays. I found the elevators quite noisy ; I asked to change room as I thought the noise was coming from the nearby ice machine, but then realized the elevator noise could be heard from everywhere. A bit of a pity that there is no minibar, or at least a can of water and orange juice. The bed was very comfortable. All in all, a very pleasant business stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but not Luxury.”
Reviews.Author: CalibHfx
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location just a block from the Burrard Inlet waterfront. Our 9th floor room had a view (between two buildings) of the water and mountains. You can watch float planes take off and land. The staff our friendly and the rooms are clean (it is fairly new). The decor is sparse and modern. There is little warmth with just one piece of art and off white walls. Staff are friendly and always offer a greeting. I would say it is a solid 3 * hotel. No extras like a room fridge. The bathroom amenities are not luxurious and the toilet and facial tissue are bargain bin quality. The free wireless worked well. Other than that it is a good choice if you can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my Gosh this was terrible”
Reviews.Author: jimmyriggs
Reviews.Content: The valet staff were absolutely amazing and the staff seemed friendly enough but I was overcharged 1300 dollars. I had my room barged in on from construction workers, they were sanding my door while I tried to sleep, No pool working, no ice machines working(though they were very prompt with the ice from room service). The hotel is nice and the people were very good but when I had to really really hustle to get my money back that they overcharged, I am really really irate and think it's absolute BS that I had to argue with them that I didn't steal a pillow, DID NOT DAMAGE THE ROOM and did NOT need to ask them for my 1300 dollars back!! WHAT IS WITH THAT??? THEY MADE ME WORK FOR MY MONEY?? F Coal coast and I wouldn't stay there if I were you

Reviews.Title: “Not quite ready to be open....”
Reviews.Author: lisacun
Reviews.Content: This hotel has promise - but I'd give it six months to be ready to visit. The staff is friendly, but many are still learning about the hotel themselves. I checked in and my room didn't have any hotel information about room service, amenities, phone operations, etc. Probably an oversite - but if a new hotel is trying to impress guests they should at least provide the basic how-to documentation. I also learned that all of my associates received a coupon for a complimentary app in the hotel restaurant upon arrival with their checkin docs -- along with a much more thorough welcome. The hotel needs to work to clean up inconsistencies. The biggest things that stuck out to me were: [1] the towels!!! I don't know where they're from, but they leave massive amounts of lint on every surface they touch! Beware - it's hard to get off. I was told it's because they're new - but I've never had new towels do anything close to this.... [2] They don't offer conditioner or hairdryers in the rooms. [3] There are no full-length mirrors in the rooms - would be easy to add to the back of a door. [4] The front desk never told me about the 'master switch' to turn everything on in the room - good to know about when you're trying to find your way into the space. [5] The fitness room was 20% operational the first day with treadmills only - no TVs or water or anything. The second day it was closed. I won't stay here again for awhile -- maybe down the road a ways, but there are way too many gaps in service and quality to make it worth while....

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sonics
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel on the first day it opened. All I can say is WOW! this hotel is nice. Nikki the Front Office manager was wonderful, got us checked in and showed us around this property. I can see that this will be my new favorite hotel in downtown. A bonus is that the convention center is within walking distance. Through out our weekend stay, the front desk staff was always very nice and helpful. The rooms are big, and high ceilings, and the Internet worked like a charm. I will have to remember my I-Pod, as my room had an I-Pod station. Some things was not working properly at the hotel, but this will be a a beautiful hotel once all the construction is done. This hotel has my business!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: HMC1
Reviews.Content: The hotel just opened about 10 days ago, and we've never stayed in a hotel this new before. This is the first review. The property still had that "new hotel" smell. Checkin was quick, and we got our room early, before checkin time. Extended checkout was permitted upon request. Room was a decent size with big windows. It's a high rise with lots of high rises around, so our view was of the next building over. Room had a flat screen TV and soft, comfortable bedding. Internet was free (wireless, code provided on request from front desk), which was not expected since it was not advertised. Location is great -- just a block or so from the harbour, and 7-minute walk from the Waterfront SkyTrain station up Hastings Street. Can walk to Stanley Park in about 10 minutes. There's a grocery store and drugstore across the street, 7-Eleven around the corner, and several coffee shops nearby. More restaurants and shops are up on Robson St., which is a 3-4 minute walk up the hill. The hotel having just opened, missed a couple finishing touches in our room (forgot the remote and phone), but that was resolved in a couple minutes after notifying the front desk. Ice machines weren't yet installed, but Room Service was quick to bring ice on request. The hotel staff was very friendly and hospitable, even following up on things after the fact, and staff were always asking what we thought of the place. They seemed genuinely interested in making sure we were happy and wanted to hear any feedback since the property was so new.
